title: taiwan_(hetalia)
body:
[i][[axis_powers_hetalia|Axis Powers Hetalia]][/i]'s [[personification|representation]] of the Republic of China/Taiwan. A cute girl with brown hair, a distinctive [[ahoge]] and pink [[hair flower]]s, she wears a pink shirt and a white dress.

While not appearing that much in the anime, she was popular among Japanese fans, but more importantly, among Taiwanese fans as well.

title: leongar
body:
A boss from [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]]. An anthropomorphic [[lion]], Leongar is the undisputed king of the Beast Pack. However, before the game's events, he fell under the mind control of [[Fecto Forgo|ID-F86]], which used his body and subjects to plot its escape from Lab Discovera's abandoned facilities.
After the creature's body was destroyed in battle by [[Kirby]], it took Leongar to the psychic realm of Forgo Dreams, shattering his soul and scattering its pieces across the land in order to claim his body and lead an army of phantom copies of the game's bosses.
H4. See also
* "WiKirby":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Leongar

title: kirby_and_the_forgotten_land
body:
The first open 3D [[Kirby (series)|]] game in the series, released for the [[Nintendo Switch]] on March 25, 2022. [[Kirby]] embarks on an adventure through the titular forgotten land, called the New World, to rescue [[Waddle Dee]]s kidnapped by the ferocious Beast Pack. 
Two new [[copy_ability|copy abilities]] were added, [[Ranger Kirby]] and [[Drill Kirby]]. The main gimmick of the game is [[Mouthful Mode]]. An extra campaign, [[Star-Crossed World]], was added to the [[Nintendo Switch 2]] version.

title: milan_kestrel
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], part of the group [[Mitarashi-dan]]. Previously known as Onibushi Chihaya when he debuted as part of Anycolor's [[Virtual Talent Academy]]. Designed by [[Kurono Yuu]].

For his default hairstyle he has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair]] and [[yellow eyes]].
For his default costume, he wears a [[blue jacket]] with a [[starry print]], a [[blue shrug]], a [[white shirt]], [[blue gloves]], [[blue pants]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[shoes]].

title: odd_taxi
body:
Odd Taxi is a 2021 anime by OLM and P.I.C.S, centering on an anthropomorphic walrus taxi driver. A manga was developed concurrently and released prior to the anime's premiere. A follow-up light novel adaptation and a film were subsequently released.

Note: [spoilers]The characters do have canon human appearances that are distinct from fanmade [[humanization]]s of their [[furry]] designs, so be mindful of this when tagging any posts that feature the characters as humans to avoid mistags.[/spoilers]

h4. Characters

* [[Odokawa Hiroshi]]

title: hoshirube_sho
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the group [[Dytica (nijisanji)|]], his name is meant to be read as [b]Hoshirube Shou[/b]. Designed by [[Miya (ete)|]]. 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], and [[grey eyes]]. His default outfit comprises a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]], [[white pants]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[purple socks]], and black [[shoes]], with a [[multicolored clothes|multicolored]] [[long skirt]] fastened by a [[white belt]] and is seen holding a [[briefcase]]. He also has optional [[tentacles]] and [[tentacle hair]]. 

Worth noting is that he had an entirely different guise during his time in ANYCOLOR's [[Virtual Talent Academy]] (ex. post #8757724), sporting short grey hair instead of long purple hair.

title: agal
body:
[b]Agal[/b] (Arabic: عِقَال) is an Arab men's clothing accessory. It is a ring-shaped black cord, worn doubled, used to keep a ghutrah (or [[keffiyeh]]) in place on the wearer's head.

title: matara_kan_(god_empress)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[Indie Virtual Youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Matara Kan]].

Having ascended to god empress, she wears a [[green kimono|green]] [[multicolored kimono|and]] [[white kimono|white]] [[off-shoulder dress|off-shoulder]] [[kimono]] resembling a [[lotus]] with a dark green [[obi]], a [[gold crown]], [[green gloves|green]] [[elbow gloves]] with [[fake claws]] and [[sandals]] resembling [[okobo]]. Notably, for this costume she has [[extra digits|human hands and feet]], as well as genuine [[insect wings|wings]] rather than her hair mimicking the shape of them.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] she sports a [[long hair|long]] and [[wavy hair|wavy]] cut, [[gradient hair|fading]] to [[green hair]] at the tip.

h4. Appearance

* !post #9543383: Reference sheet

[/tr]
[tr]

[td][[Harbinger (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Real Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Mikki Isle (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Shiroinger (racehorse)|]] (By [[Harbinger (racehorse)|]] and [[Yukichan (racehorse)|]]). A non-white horse from the [[Shirayukihime (racehorse)|]] lineage of white horses, she is best known for her difficult temper as well as her familial relationship with [[Sodashi (racehorse)|]]. Adding to her infamy is that her main jockey is [[Ikezoe Ken'ichi]], best known for racing on particularly difficult horses.

Although she was a solid sprinter with 3 G2s, she never won any G1s due to her own moodiness and temper, her results even being all-or-nothing (7 victories, no podiums and 5 placements - all G1 races - in 20 races). She instead ended up being the spectator of Sodashi and [[Mama Cocha (racehorse)|]]'s own G1s. She retired after the 2024 Takamatsunomiya Kinen.

title: dr._ratio_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Real name [b]Veritas Ratio[/b] (Latin: Truth Reason), voiced by [[Takeuchi Shunsuke]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. His default outfit is [[greco-roman clothes|Greco-Roman]] in style and comprises a [[black shirt]] top, [[white tunic]] with the Intelligentsia Guild's badge on the left breast side, [[blue pants]], and golden [[sandals]]. Often carrying his [[dr._ratio's_book_(honkai:_star_rail)|signature book]].

h4. Costumes
* !post #7691400: Splash art
* !post #7977851: [[Dr. Ratio (Academia) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Academia]]
* !post #7848610: [[Dr. Ratio (Final Victor) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Final Victor]]
* !post #9062733: [[Dr. Ratio (Star Rail Live 2025) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Star Rail Live 2025]]

His Chinese name 真理医生 can be translated as Dr. Reason. Much like [[Dan Heng (Imbibitor Lunae) (Honkai: Star Rail)|"Imbibitor Lunae"]], Dr. Ratio's name is also taken from Latin, with "Ratio" meaning "Reason".

In some languages of the game, his name is Dr. Truth instead, which is an [i]acceptable[/i] translation though "Truth" is generally shown as 真相 and not as 真理 which is what they use for his name. According to early leaks, his name was originally going to be "Doctor of Truth".

title: aki_sandwich_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] arising from the [[Touhou]] Popularity Polls, where the sisters [[Aki Minoriko]] and [[Aki Shizuha]] have often obtained results that end up with one or two other characters ranked right in between them. This has resulted in fanart of said character(s) being caught in a [[girl sandwich]] between the two sisters.

h4. See also
* [[scarlet sandwich (meme)]]

title: scarlet_sandwich_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] derived from the [[Touhou]] Popularity Polls, it involves instances where the results end up with a character placing right between the rankings of the sisters [[Remilia Scarlet]] and [[Flandre Scarlet]], resulting in fanart of said character being caught in a [[girl sandwich]] between the two sisters.

h4. See also
* [[aki sandwich (meme)]]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Kurofune (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Buchiko (racehorse)|]], Mama Cocha is a non-white full sister to [[Sodashi (racehorse)|]], being a bay mare with a blaze marking and a pastern on the right hind leg.

Although she matured more slowly as Sodashi, she eventually became a solid sprinter of her own and eventually won her first graded race (and indeed, first G1) at the 2023 Sprinters Stakes by a nose.

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Special Week (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Toho Gaia (racehorse)|]]. He is famous for winning and shattering the record at the 2014 Kikuka Sho and infamous for being the instigator of [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]]'s late start at the 2015 Takarazuka Kinen. He is also one of Special Week's only progeny to become a stallion in any capacity.

title: gold_ship_(racehorse)
body:
[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Sire:[/td]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Grandsire:[/td]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Point Flag (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Mejiro McQueen (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

A [[real life]] [[Japan]]ese [[horse|racehorse]]. Namesake and model of the [[Umamusume]] character [[Gold Ship (Umamusume)|]].

As a gray horse, he was born a chestnut before turning gray. In his racing prime, he was a dapple gray with a wide blaze marking with a distinctive forking snip, a stocking on his right back leg and a coronet on his left back leg. With age, he now has an almost fully white coat, with only the markings being whiter. He commonly ran with a black hood emblazoned with his name, usually without the ear covers, wearing blinkers and a shadow roll.

Gold Ship became infamous for its unpredictable temperament and [[12 billion yen incident|wildly inconsistent performances]], as well as being popular after retirement for being somewhat of a goof. Nevertheless, it had a greatly successful career, with over ¥1b in total earnings.

As a stallion, he had tremendous success in actually breeding and conceiving children, and as a sire, he at least had several graded winners, their main weakness being how many of them inherited his temperament and moodiness.

h4. See Also
* [[Just A Way (racehorse)|]] - Stablemate and best friend
* [[Sugai Naosuke]] - Golshi's trainer and arch nemesis (?)

* [[Point Flag (racehorse)|]] - Dam
* [[Mejiro McQueen (racehorse)|]] - Damsire
* [[Uberleben (racehorse)|]] - Golshi's daughter and first G1 winner
* [[Meiner Grand (racehorse)|]] - Golshi's most successful son in Steeplechase
* [[Meisho Tabaru (Racehorse)|]] - Golshi's current best progeny
* [[aoraki_(jpn)_(2020)_(racehorse)|Aoraki]] - Golshi's son and a white hair
* [[Gorgeous (Jpn) (2022) (Racehorse)|Gorgeous]]  - Golshi's daughter and another white hair

* [[Gentildonna (racehorse)|]] - Rival

title: gorgeous_(jpn)_(2022)_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]In Japanese, a mash-up of her parents' names ([b]Go[/b]ld Ship + Satono [b]Jas[/b]mine). Otherwise, the meaning is obvious.)[/tn]

[table]

[td][[Wilburn (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese racehorse born in 2022. Sired by [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Satono Jasmine (racehorse)|]] (who is from the White Beauty lineage of white horses).

This promising white filly is the second white horse sired by Gold Ship, following [[aoraki_(jpn)_(2020)_(racehorse)|Aoraki]] and followed by her younger sister "Satono Jasmine's 2023" (name pending).

She initially gained infamy due to her late start at her first graded race at the 2024 Fantasy Stakes (G3) as the favourite, finishing 12th place.

Not to be confused with the [[gorgeous_(jpn)_(2001)_(racehorse)|Japanese racehorse born in 2001]], the [[gorgeous_(jpn)_(1988)_(racehorse)|Japanese racehorse born in 1988]], the [[gorgeous_(usa)_(racehorse)|American racehorse born in 1986]], or the [[gorgeous_(brz)_(racehorse)|Brazilian racehorse born in 1996]].

[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Casta Diva (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[High Chaparral (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Real-Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and foaled by (New Zealand-bred white horse) [[Casta Diva (racehorse)|]]. A third-generation descendant of The Opera House's lineage of white horses, he is himself a white horse with blue eyes and a wild disposition that is a perfect match for "Horse Whisperer" jockey [[Ikezoe Ken'ichi]].

He is actually the first of three white horses sired by Gold Ship, the two others being [[Satono Jasmine (racehorse)|]]'s [[Gorgeous (JPN) (2022) (racehorse)|2022]] and 2023 foals (Satono Jasmine being from the White Beauty lineage), both fillies.

After being winless in 17 races in Central, he was sent to the regionals in Nagoya, where, in his second try at Kasamatsu, he finally won his first race.

title: fecto_forgo
body:
The penultimate boss and main antagonist of [i][[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]][/i], referred to with the name "ID-F86" and the title of "the ultimate life-form". They and [[Elfilin]] are two halves of a powerful and extraterrestial being known as [[Fecto Elfilis]].
Many years before the game's events, it arrived on the New World to endanger its wildlife. Once captured by the planet's inhabitants, its teleportation abilities were researched for years until the resulting technology was used to depart from the planet, leaving the creature alone and incomplete.
H6. Alternate forms
* [[Fecto Forgo (Larva)]] 
* [[Fecto Forgo (Monster)]]

title: italian_brainrot_ai_animals_(meme)
body:
A series of "brainrot" memes involving [[ai-generated art (topic)|AI-generated]] images depicting [[fusion]]s of [[animal]]s, [[plant]]s, and objects, often with human [[feet]]. 
The "Italian" refers to the male Italian text-to-speech voiceover generally used, as the meme evolved gradually on [[TikTok]] in early 2025.

Notable examples include: 
* [[Tralalero Tralala]]: a [[shark]] wearing 3 [[Nike (company)|]] [[sneakers]]
* [[Brr Brr Patapim]]: a giant creature with the head of a [[proboscis monkey|proboscis]] [[monkey]], [[tree]]-like limbs and large human [[feet]]
* [[Bombardiro Crocodilo]]: a [[bomber]] [[airplane]] with a [[crocodile]] head
* [[Tung Tung Tung Sahur]]: an anthropomorphized wooden log holding a [[baseball bat]] (with Indonesian language voiceover) 
* [[Lirili Larila]]: a giant creature with the head of an [[elephant]] and body resembling a [[saguaro]] [[cactus]], wearing [[sandals]]
* !post #9147579

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme:  Italian Brainrot / AI Italian Animals":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/italian-brainrot-ai-italian-animals]

title: elegg_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. A member of the [[Electric Shock (nikke)|]] squad with [[Trony (nikke)|]].

She specializes in electronics. Her goal is to [[it_runs_doom_(meme)|install her favorite FPS video game BOOM on every device with a screen]].

Her characterization is a homage to the [[Doom (series)|]] franchise. Her [[boomstick (nikke)|weapon]] is based on the [[BFG 9000]] from the 2005 movie, [[Doom (2005 movie)|]]. The cover art for the character from BOOM is a homage to the cover art of [[Doom (2016)]]. Elegg's obsession of installing BOOM to every device is a reference to how people can play the original 1993 Doom on certain devices such as a [[calculator]].

She has a [[short hair|short]] [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[blonde hair]] which [[hair over eyes|covers]] her [[purple eyes]] along with [[huge breasts]] and [[plump]] body. Her outfit consists of a [[crop top]] with [[black sports bra]], [[suspenders]], [[thigh strap]], and a [[short shorts]] with a [[bag]] on her left side.

Illustrator: [[jam (nandade)|]]
Voice actress: [[Itou Ayasa]] (JP)

h4. Appearance

body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a member of the [[Unlimited (nikke)|]] squad along with [[Ludmilla (nikke)|]], [[Neve (nikke)|]], and [[Tove (Nikke)|]]. 

She seems to look at the world as if it's a fairy tale as evidenced by calling her fellow colleague as "Queen", the [[Commander (nikke)|]] as "Rabbity", and the leader of the [[rapture (nikke)|]]s as "The Queen of hearts".

She has [[pink eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] stylized in [[twintails]] with [[bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[pink bodysuit]] that is [[skin tight]], [[animal ear headphones]], a [[red jacket|red]]/[[pink jacket|pink]] [[cropped jacket]], [[pink gloves|pink]] & [[white gloves|white]] [[two-tone gloves]], and [[white shoes|white]] [[sneakers]]. body:
[b]Dandadan[/b] is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Yukinobu Tatsu]]. It has been serialized in Shueisha's Shōnen Jump+ service since April 2021, with its chapters collected into twenty tankōbon volumes as of July 2025.

An anime series produced by [[Science SARU]] premiered in October 2024.

Evolves into [[Gumshoos]].

body:
[[Star (symbol)|]]s circling around a character's head, indicating they are stunned, [[dizzy]], [[dazed]], [[unconscious]], or knocked out.

In some cases, the symbol shown circling the character's head may be something else besides a star, such as some kind of [[bird]].

Should not be used if a character is literally looking at the stars. See [[starry sky]] instead.

title: god_emperor_lovelias_(lantern_pumpkin)
body:
God Empress Ravelies

Height: 175cm

First Person: I

Second Person: You

The Empress appeared at the end of the war when the Empire's home planet, Albaterra, was still unified. She quickly put an end to the conflict and unified the planet. She has continued to reign as the Empire's God Empress for over a thousand years.

With the goal of creating a "unified galactic nation with the Empire at its apex," she has been absorbing other planets as subordinates and working to conquer the entire galaxy.

Despite her galactic conquest, she maintains the cultures of subordinate states and governs with compassion, adopting a protective occupation policy that enriches the Empire itself through overall development.

She loves all her subjects, including subordinate states, but is cold-hearted and only allows the conquered planets the choice between loyalty and war, completely refusing to accept "coexistence."

PRWHS

"My beloved subjects,

I share in your prosperity."

"You have a choice: pledge your loyalty to the Empire

and bestow your blessings, or bow to its power as an enemy."

Divine Star Galactic Empire

title: reinrassig_iii
body:
Reinrassig III, seventh son of the Noble Highbreed House of Di Ralla, direct descendant of the Pure Blooded High Order of Rasecht, also known as Reiney, is a [[Highbreed (Ben 10)|]] with a partially [[Swampfire|Methanosian]] arm and the current [[Highbreed (Ben 10)|]] Supreme.

Reinrassig III looks like a regular [[extra eyes|four-eyed]] [[Highbreed (Ben 10)|]] but now he has a partially Methanosian right arm, in which holds the Imperial Seal on its palm.

title: agnes_digital_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character.

Digital (referred to in game as Digi-tan) is a diehard [[otaku]] fan of [[horse girl]]s, analogous to an [[idol]] otaku in real life. She is often seen fangirling over her fellow schoolmates/colleagues or cheering them on with [[glowstick]]s. This trait is exaggerated in fanart, where she will often react violently (i.e. heart attack, massive nosebleed, [[so moe I'm gonna die!]]) to whatever wholesome or adorable event she deems "precious".

Her portrayal as an otaku is due to the real life horse's nickname of "Deviant Horse" or "Hentai Horse", referring to the horse's success as a Jack-of-all-trades (and not to any particular sexual attraction to other horses). In the game, she thrives on all terrains as well as Mile and Medium distances and is relatively well balanced on stats.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3076209: [[Tracen School Uniform]]
* !post #7607837: [[Agnes Digital (Super Express! Full Color Special) (Umamusume)|Super Express! Full Color Special]] 
* !post #3075740: [[Agnes Digital (Super Express! Full Color Special) (Umamusume)|Super Express! Full Color Special]] (Draft)
* !post #4992215: [[Starting Future (umamusume)|]]
* !post #6624916: [[Agnes Digital (Casual) (Umamusume)|Casual]]
* !post #8355933: [[agnes digital (lovely jiangshi) (umamusume)|Lovely Jiangshi]]

title: mihono_bourbon_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]], voiced by [[Hasegawa Ikumi]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown_hair|brown]] [[inward flipped hair]] with [[double-parted bangs]] decorated with a [[metal_hairband|metal]] [[hairband]].

Mihono Bourbon has an appropriately stoic and robotic personality to the point that even her character lapses are somehow in-character, often making her do a confused "does not compute" [[blank stare]] à la [[Space Cat (meme)|]].

Ironically, despite her theme, she is terrible with technology, sometimes to the point of frying computers by her simple presence. Her history is intertwined with [[Rice Shower (Umamusume)]]'s as they were rivals in real life. She refers to her [[Trainer (Umamusume)|]] as "Master".

h4. Appearance

title: air_groove_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Voiced by [[Aoki Ruriko]]. 

Vice President of the Tracen Academy Student Council. Frequently the victim of [[Symboli Rudolf (umamusume)|]]'s [i]horrible[/i] puns.

Air Groove's official character profile originally had a line mentioning that "she hates men because of a certain traumatic incident in a race". This was a reference to the 1997 Japan Cup incident where another horse, [[Pilsudski (Racehorse)|]], won the race in front of Air Groove in spite of said horse flashing at the paddock in front of the crowd (and other horses including Air Groove), which is normally seen as a sign of distraction by Japanese horse racing fans. This line was subsequently removed, but the incident is still referenced in Air Groove's relationship with [[Fine Motion (Umamusume)|]], as the real-life Fine Motion is the half-sister of [[Pilsudski (Racehorse)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3076061: [[Tracen school uniform]]

title: chrono_genesis_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]]. 

The history buff/racing [[otaku]]. A small, seemingly mild-mannered [[horse girl]] who loves studying history. She particularly loves race histories, especially the interplay of the actions and dreams of the numerous horse girls and their trainers. Anticipating the potential results, every week, she goes off to the racecourses with a camera in hand as well as writing her own analysis.

As she is practically a horse (girl) racing [[otaku]], she is sometimes paired with [[Agnes Digital (umamusume)|]], who is a "Umamusume-chan" otaku, a fan of the horse girls themselves. 

Voiced by Manase Hiyori.

body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Student council president of Tracen Academy, voiced by [[Tadokoro Azusa]].

Rudolf is infamous for having a penchant for cracking horrible 'dad joke'-level puns. This causes [[Air Groove (Umamusume)|]] (her vice-president) no end of grief.

Japanese fan artists may also sometimes draw a younger version of Rudolf, which they name "Luna". This nickname is derived from the actual childhood name of the real-life [[Symboli Rudolf (racehorse)|]].

title: mayano_top_gun_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. 

A little maverick of a throughbred, Mayano Top Gun is a young-looking [[horse girl]] who is named as well as having part of her personality based around the movie [[Top Gun]]. When she isn't spouting aeronautical references, she is trying (too hard) to be [[age_conscious|treated as an adult]], yet despite of this she is notably capable of learning quick and is able to grasp the situation such as answering a math question. This is reflected in-game where she is capable of running in different strategies.

Her racing outfit was influenced by the movie [[Top Gun]] (her jacket is nearly identical to that worn by [[Pete "Maverick" Mitchell]]). When it came to promote [[Top Gun: Maverick]] (or, rather, due to her very presence), she was the natural choice to "advertise the movie":[/posts/5348482].

title: the_lantern_bearers_(painting)
body:
A 1908 painting by American painter and illustrator Maxfield Parrish, created for [i]Collier's[/i] magazine. It depicts a group of clowns on a stage-like setting, hanging glowing yellow [[lantern]]s against a silhouetted tree and a “Parrish Blue” sky, with four more golden [[orb]]s reminiscent of [[full moon]] in the background. 

h4. External links 
* "Wikipedia (Artist)":https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maxfield_Parrish

title: confederate_flag
body:
Dating to the [[American Civil War]], the flag popularly known as "the confederate flag" was the [[battle standard]] used by the [[Confederate States of America]]'s Army of Northern Virginia, and was also used as the CSA's naval ensign displayed as a smaller canton with a white field.

Contrary to popular belief, it was never used as the national flag of the Confederacy, nor was it used by any of the Confederacy's armies west of Virginia. It is sometimes mistakenly called "Stars and Bars", which was the nickname of the actual first national flag of the Confederate States.

After the war, the ANV battle flag was adopted by many Southern groups opposed to Reconstruction and a century later was used as a banner for groups opposed to Civil Rights and Integration, leading to its status as a divisive symbol today. In modern days, the flags are associated with white supremacy and [[racism]] in a similar vein to the [[Nazi flag]].

All flags connected to the Confederate States other than the aforementioned flag could be also be given the 'confederate_flag' tag.

h4. Examples

* !asset #32235980: The "Stars and Bars"/National Flag of the Confederate States
* !asset #32235985: Army of Northern Virginia [[battle standard]] 

h4. See also
* [[Ku Klux Klan]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Flags of the Confederate States of America":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flags_of_the_Confederate_States_of_America]
other_names: アメリカ連合国の国旗

title: green_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Green[/b], known as [b]Blue[/b] (ブルー) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon lgpe|Let's Go, Pikachu! and Let's Go, Eevee!]][/i].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] including [[hair flaps]], and [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt]], [[green shorts|green]] [[short shorts]], [[white wristband|white wristbands]], [[black footwear|black]] [[sneakers]], and a [[yellow bag|yellow]] [[messenger bag]] 

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is also named [b]Green[/b] (or Blue in Japan). Green initially wears a simple [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress]] and [[white gloves]] but changes her outfit to match [[Leaf (pokemon)|Leaf]]'s in FireRed and LeafGreen arc.

title: red_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Red[/b] is the male player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

The silent type, this legendary, awesome Pokémon Trainer hardly talks at all. His best friend, [[Blue Oak|Blue]], is also his rival [tn](official bio)[/tn].

In his [[pokemon frlg|classic]] outfit, he has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[brown hair]]. He wears a [[red headwear|red]] [[baseball cap|cap]], a [[t-shirt]] under a [[red jacket|red]] [[sleeveless jacket]], [[black wristband|wristbands]], [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[blue pants|pants]], [[shoes]], a [[yellow bag|yellow]] [[backpack]], and a [[vs seeker]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is also named [b]Red[/b].

title: swimsuit
body:
A garment worn for [[swimming]], [[bathing]], and [[beach]] activities. 

Female swimwear is usually made of tight-fitting stretch fabric, either [[one-piece_swimsuit|one]] or [[bikini|two-piece]].

[[Male swimwear]] typically covers the crotch area only and can be loose ([[swim trunks|trunks]]) or tight-fitting ([[swim briefs|briefs]], [[legskin]], or [[jammers]]).

title: guy_smith_(mtkn)
body:
[Pic West] Guy Smight [Bounty Hunter]
■ Guy Smight, 33 years old, male, height: approximately 7 feet
■ He's a bounty hunter because he wants to impress the ladies.
■ His shooting skills are terrible, so he uses nearby iron pipes, lumber, and signs as weapons and uses his strength to smash through enemies. Truly a Smite Guy.
■ He has a "special" sawed-off shotgun hidden in his skirt(?), but he can only use it at close range... no, he doesn't.
■ First-person pronoun: "I," "Boy," "Big brother," "Big sister," etc.
■ He's a bold idiot with a quick temper, but he's a good guy at heart. He's easily seduced by women's charms.
□ Battle Status: Wilderness Cat → BB Gang Assault (Lucky Coin) → Battle at Cola Sour Village

title: railway_gun
body:
A railway gun, also called a railroad gun, is a large [[artillery]] piece, often surplus naval ordnance, mounted on, transported by, and fired from a specially designed railway wagon. Many countries have built railway guns, but the best known are the large Krupp-built pieces used by Germany in [[World War I]] and [[World War II]]. Smaller guns were often part of an [[armored train]].

Not to be confused with [[railgun]].

h4. See also

*  [[Armored train]]

title: sakusei_byoutou
body:
[i]Sakusei Byoutou: Seikaku Saiaku no Nurse Shika Inai Byouin de Shasei Kanri Seikatsu[/i] (lit. [i]Semen Extraction Ward ~Ejaculation Management Life in a Hospital with Only the Worst Nurses~[/i]) is an DLsite erotic CG set series written and drawn by [[Sakusei Kenkyuujo]]. The first chapter was released on December 16, 2018, and the final and 11th chapter was released on October 21, 2019.

Has many spinoffs/alternative forms such as a visual novel, a light novel, JAV, 18+ manga adapted by [[shakkiripon|Kameyama Shiruko]], an OVA, and an all ages manga.

Characters in order of appearance in the original CG set:
* [[Yamada (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Tachibana (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Kurokawa (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Yamaguchi (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Mochizuki (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Hiramatsu (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Numajiri (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Aizawa (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Kiritani (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Tendou Mia (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Amamiya (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Ootsuka (Sakusei Byoutou)|]] 
* [[Tendou Mako (Sakusei Byoutou)|]]

All of the characters are referred to by their family name, with the notable exception of Mako, being referred to as Head Nurse Tendou/Head Nurse.

Visual Novels: 
* [i]Sakusei Byoutou ~Seikaku Saiaku no Nurse Shika Inai Byouin de Shasei Kanri Seikatsu~[/i] (has the same name as the CG and manga in Japanese, and it is known as Nope Nope Nurses in English)
* [i]Sakusei Byoutou ~Jaaku naru Otsubone Nurse ga Hisomu Byouin de Choukyou Seikatsu~[/i] (known as Nope Nope Nope Nurses in English)
* [i]Sakusei Byoutou ~Kyouaku Naru Kangoshichou ga Shihai suru Byouin no Shin'en e Sennyuu Sousa~[/i] (known as Nope Nope Nope Nope Nurses in English)

title: final_flash
body:
Signature attack of [[Vegeta]] from [[Dragon Ball]] series. It consists of the user firing an [[energy beam]] using both of their hands, often in a rapid succession.

While very similar to [[Kamehameha (dragon ball)|]] in overall gesture, Final Flash typically do not requires the "charging" phase, and the beam emitted from this technique behave in a similar manner to projectile attack, compared to the continuous "wave" attack of Kamehameha's. Though the user can also performs the "charge" to release a long energy beam instead.

h4. See also
* [[Kamehameha (dragon ball)|]]
* [[Final Kamehameha]]
other_names: ファイナルフラッシュ

title: father-son_kamehameha
body:
An iconic moment from the end of the Cell Saga in [[Dragon Ball Z]], where [[Son Gohan]], and the soul of his deceased father, [[Son Goku]], combine their powers to fire the [[Kamehameha (dragon ball)|]] that would ultimately defeat [[Perfect Cell]].

Referred to as the "Parent-Child Kamehameha" in Japanese; so while the English name specifies a gender, it's gender-neutral in its original Japanese, so parodies often run the gamut of all parent-child combinations.

title: fu_hua_(phoenix)
body:
Phoenix is the form for [[Fu Hua]] as she dons a [[china_dress|chinese-themed dress]] with a red and white motif which also changes her hair colour from the original deep blue to a [[silver_hair|silver]] base with [[red_hair|red]] [[streaked_hair|streaks]] and [[gradient_hair|gradient]] red tips.

Her other outfits include:
* Sword and Fire: Black and red Medieval-style chestplate and leggings.
* Fire and Sword: Like Sword and Fire, but white instead of black, as well as her original grey hair and blue eyes.

It is Fu Hua's main/default (and seemly only) form in [[Benghuai Xueyuan]].

title: fu_hua_(azure_empyrea)
body:
A battlesuit based on when [[Fu Hua|]] was a teacher on Mount Taixuan early in the Current Era, with a white Chinese-style shoulderless gown with black and teal accents, with her ponytail much longer and her bangs covering her right eye. Other outfits include:

* Cerulean Court: a frilly, puffy white and blue wedding gown, adorned with multiple teal bird ornaments, with her hair fully down.
* Taixuan Impression: A more subtle Chinese-style outfit with a blue bodysuit overlayed by a blue and white shoulderless shirt with a skirt and curtain that go down to her knees. Her hair is more akin to her original [[Fu Hua (valkyrie Accipiter)|Valkyrie Accipiter]] hair, but her ponytail is much wider until it tapers at the bottom.

h4. Skins

* !post #7015451: [[Fu Hua (Azure Empyrea)]] Default
* !post #8007513: [[Fu Hua (Taixuan Impression)]]

title: fu_hua_(night_squire)
body:
Night Squire is one of [[Fu Hua]]'s available Valkyrja forms where she dons a blue shirt and tie with a white coat, along with black slacks and black glasses.

Other outfits include:

* Rustic Noir: A black, sleeveless shirt with white shorts and Chinese accents, omitting her glasses and letting her hair fully down, albeit with a single braid in the middle.
* Spring Traveler: A casual outfit with a green [[off-shoulder shirt]], black knee-length pants, a white and blue backpack, and a white beret that conceals most of her hair.
* Dark Butler: A pallette swap of her original outfit, where her shirt and coat are now black with yellow accents, and a yellow tie.
* Autumn Shades: A casual autumny outfit with a black shirt with a white leaf print and blue short shorts, with a Jingwei-chick backpack.

h4. Skins

* !post #3330369: [[Fu Hua (Night Squire)]] Default
* !post #6669681: [[Fu Hua (Rustic Noir)]]
* !post #7015444: [[Fu Hua (Spring Traveler)]]

title: bask_om
body:
[b]Bask Om[/b] is a captain in the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] ([[Gundam 0083]]) and later the [[Titans (gundam)|]] ([[Zeta Gundam]]). Always wears reflective [[goggles]]. 

[spoilers]Dies when the bridge of his battleship is attacked by [[AEUG]] traitor [[Reccoa Londe]] piloting the [[Palace Athene]] on [[Paptimus Scirocco]]'s orders.[/spoilers]

More recently appeared in [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]]. In this timeline, the Titans are not established as of U.C. 0085, but he schemes for a far-right division within the [[Earth Federation]].

It is a [[black bodysuit]] with additional [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[armor]] pieces for her chest and waistline, armored [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], and mechanical [[hair ornament]]s on both sides of her head. In the story, it was provided to her by [[otto_apocalypse|Otto Apocalpyse]] for when she was a spy for the Schicksal to watch [[Kiana Kaslana|]] at St. Freya.

title: himeko_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Tanaka Rie]] in Japanese. 

An adventurous scientist who encountered and repaired a stranded train as a child. She now ventures across the universe with her train currently named the [[Astral Express (honkai: star rail)|]], operating as its navigator. 

She has [[yellow eyes]], [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[red hair]], and [[large breasts]] with a [[mole_on_breast|mole on her right breast]]. She typically wears a [[white dress]] that shows off her [[cleavage]], [[black coat]] with the Nameless' badge on the right side, [[black gloves]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[pumps]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7689866: Splash art
* !post #8768421: Night on the Milky Way (Signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
An adventurous scientist who encountered the Astral Express as a child when it got stranded in her home world.

At that time, some existence in the Express revealed to this young girl a whole world outside of her own — the universe.

Years later, Himeko finally repaired the train and began her journey to the stars, but she realized that this was only the beginning. On the Trailblaze path, she would need many more companions...

Even though such companions may have different destinations in mind, they all gaze at the same starry sky.
[/expand]


h4. See also
* [[Murata Himeko]] - her [[Benghuai Xueyuan]] and [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] counterpart.
* [[Mavuika (Genshin Impact)]] - Her [[Genshin Impact]] counterpart.

title: alkaid_mcgrath_(spirit_world)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]] character. [[Alkaid McGrath]]’s alternate self in the Spirit World. Lord of the Forest and Spirit Lord of the Third Era, creator of the Sky City and the Circle of Earth. A Deer Spirit whose particular origin makes him immune to the Corruption, he has dedicated himself to reverse the spread of the corrupted forest and protect the Spirit World.

He wears a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] [[open robe|open]] [[white robe]] and [[white shorts]], alongside [[head chain]], [[gold necklace]], [[gold earrings]], [[bracer]], and [[anklet]]. He has [[deer antlers]] and stays [[barefoot]]. His animal form is a white [[deer]].

title: baltimore_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the US Navy heavy cruiser [i]USS Baltimore[/i] (CA-68). 
Character design by [[Keli Bang]], voiced by [[Takahashi Minami (voice Actor)|]].

She is a [[tomboy]] similar to [[Cleveland_(azur_lane)|]], with [[short_hair|short]], [[brown hair]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She's noted to be good at virtually anything she puts her mind to, from battlefield tactics to team sports, but gets flustered easily when put into more feminine clothing that flatters her admittedly curvy figure.

title: kafka_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A member of the [[Stellaron Hunters (honkai: star rail)|]], voiced by [[Itou Shizuka]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[empty eyes|blank]] [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], [[black jacket]] with a [[spider web print]] on the back, [[black shorts|black]] [[high-waist shorts]], [[purple pantyhose]], single [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, [[purple gloves]], multiple [[ring]]s, and [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh boot]] on her right, black ankle-length [[boots|boot]] on her left), and a black-tinted [[pince-nez]].

body:

title: minecraft_youtube
body:
A term generally used to refer to specific Western [[Minecraft]] video content on platforms such as [[YouTube]] and [[twitch.tv|Twitch]], especially those surrounding survival multiplayer servers (SMPs) and the communities that develop from them. Some creators stream themselves acting out elaborate LARPs in SMPs, which inspire artists to draw fanart of the characters they play. Both art of the streamers and art of the Minecraft servers they stream go here.

The term is applied more on a cultural level than on a literal level - YouTubers that play Minecraft once often aren't considered to fall into this category as they do not have wider connections to the scene as a whole, which is largely collaborative and overlaps often.

Please note that the [[real life]] copytag should only be used for posts actually depicting content creators in real life and not their personas or in-game characters. Additionally, [[Minecraft]] should not be tagged unless elements from the game are present (such as scenery, locations, items, species, etc).

Western Minecraft creators are particularly popular on the Chinese internet, where videos are often reprinted with subtitles. Netizens make a distinction between these creators (MCYT) and domestic creators (MCUP).

title: poke_ball
body:
A spherical capsule used to capture and store [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]]. The most common and recognized Poké Ball is the basic variant, which has two colored halves: red on top and white on bottom. It is one of the central symbols of the franchise. Known as a [i]Monster Ball[/i] in Japan.

Normally, captured Pokémon are shrunken down and stored inside the ball, though some refuse to go inside the Poké Balls. [[ash ketchum|Ash]]'s [[Pikachu]] is a notable example.

Some Pokémon are noticeably similar to Poké Balls: [[Voltorb]], [[Electrode (pokemon)|]], [[Foongus]], [[Amoonguss]], [[Galarian Stunfisk]], and [[Brute Bonnet]].

Don't tag Poké Balls as [[ball]]s or [[holding ball]]. Use [[poke ball]], [[holding poke ball]], etc instead. Don't tag [[Tera Orb]]s as Poké Balls.

h4. Examples

title: quilted_clothes
body:
Clothing made from multiple layers of fabric that are stitched together with padding sandwiched in between, resulting in a three-dimensional pattern. This may be done for extra insulation, for protection from injury, or for aesthetics.

Some common kinds include Channel quilting, for lengthwise stitchlines that are parallel, and Trapunto, for raised geometric shapes.

h4.See also
* [[padded armor]]
* [[quilted coat]]
* [[quilted jacket]]

title: zora
body:
A race of fish humanoids in the [i][[the legend of zelda|Legend of Zelda]][/i] franchise. They first appear in [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time]][/i].

They generally live in areas with large amounts of water. Usually a people with a prominent royal line, long lived, and technologically advanced.

In [i][[the legend of zelda: the wind waker|The Wind Waker]][/i], they are a distant relative of the [[Rito]]. May or may not be related to the [[Parella]] of [i][[the legend of zelda: skyward sword|Skyward Sword]][/i].

title: plana_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable character in [[Blue Archive]]. Similar in appearance to [[Arona (Blue Archive)|]]. 

She has [[black eyes]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] worn [[hair over one eye|over one eye]] and has [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]]. She wears all black, including a [[black serafuku]], [[black coat|coat]], [[black pantyhose|pantyhose]], [[black choker|choker]], and [[black hairband|hairband]], with a [[white neckerchief]]. Like [[Arona (Blue Archive)|]], she has [[mismatched pupils]]: her right pupil is [[blue pupils|blue]] while her left pupil is [[pink pupils|pink]].

[spoiler]Originally referred to as A.R.O.N.A., she is later renamed "Plana" by [[Arona (blue archive)|]] after the events of the Final Chapter, once she decides to join [[Sensei (Blue Archive)|]] and cohabitate in the Shittim Chest with [[Arona (blue archive)|]].[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21310314: Default

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Plana":[https://bluearchive.fandom.com/wiki/Plana]
other_names: プラナ(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: arona_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable character from [[Blue Archive]]. [[Sensei (blue archive)|]]'s virtual assistant residing in the Shittim Chest.

She is the main mascot of Blue Archive, appearing as the figurehead on its website and social media. In addition to providing information and updates to Sensei, she also runs a series of videos called Arona Channel, as well as being the one who is representing the in-game [[gacha (game mechanic)|]] mechanics by randomly giving the player an envelope representing student's application.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[light blue hair|blue hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair|undertones]], worn [[hair over one eye|over one eye]]. She has [[mismatched pupils]]: her right pupil is [[blue pupils|blue]] while her left pupil is [[pink pupils|pink]].
She carries an [[umbrella_gun|umbrella]] [[shotgun]], which she uses to delete data.

Voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #5441079: Default

h4. See also

* [[Plana (Blue Archive)|]]
* [[General Student Council President (Blue Archive)|]]

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Arona":[https://bluearchive.fandom.com/wiki/Arona]
other_names: アロナ(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: mika_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. She's a Trinity student and a former member of the [[Tea Party (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is Misono Mika. 

She has a [[pink halo]], [[yellow eyes]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[pink hair|pink]] and [[blue hair]] with a [[single side bun|single]] [[side up bun]] and a [[hair flower]], in addition to [[low wings|low]] [[angel wings]] that have [[wing ornament|wing ornaments]].

Her regular outfit consists of a [[white capelet]] over a [[medium dress|medium]], [[double-breasted|double breast buttoned]], [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]], [[white dress|white]], [[frilled dress]]; a [[white skirt|white]], [[high-waist skirt]]; a [[underbust]] [[overskirt]]; a [[wrist scrunchie]]; [[white pantyhose]]; and [[black shoes|black]] [[pumps]].

Her personal weapon is based on the [[Lanchester SMG]].

Voiced by: [[Touyama Nao]]
Original artist: [[yutokamizu]]

h4. Appearance

title: luna_(pgr)
body:
Playable character, boss encounter and recurring deuteragonist in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. Voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]].

Agent of the Ascension Network, a title granted to the highest ranking Ascendant - a recurring deuteragonist faction that believes in the salvation of humanity through adherence to the Ascension Network's commands and will.

Originally human, she took the place of her older sister [[Lucia (PGR)|]] from undergoing Construct surgery. The surgery was initially deemed a failure and she was to be scrapped along with the other failures of her batch. It was then that she uncovered the Ascension Network in her survival and struggle, and began a hate-fueled war against humanity.

h4. Appearance

h6. NPC

title: drawing_tablet
body:
On Danbooru this will typically refer to a flat, rectangular surface used as a tactile interface to a computer-based drawing program. Often this is used in conjunction with a [[stylus]], to better approximate the handling of a real-life pen, pencil or brush. 

For the computers that incorporates a built in touchscreen see the [[tablet pc]] tag. Not to be confused with a [[stone tablet]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graphics_tablet]

title: witch_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Female Mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|]]. Also known as the Trickster or Geniewiz.

Her "default appearance":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/f/f4/WitchPortrait.PNG] features her wearing a red one-piece dress, a black cape, black witch hat, and black shoes with curled ends. Some of her minor familiars are sitting atop of her head and shoulders. A bandage adorns her nose.

As a "Trickster":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/e/ea/New_Geniewiz.png], her hair is styled into twintails and has taken on a slightly pink tinge. Her witch hat is replaced with a comically large one, the top of her one-piece is white, and she now has a bandage on her cheek. She also wears a red capelet, black thighhighs, and carries around a small red bag with random tools and candy in it. Some of her homunculi are seen flying around in the background.

As a "Neo Witch":[https://wiki.dfo-world.com/images/5/5d/Neo-_Witch_Artwork.jpg], she wears a long black and red jacket and her witch hat is of immense proportions. She wears black kneesocks, exposing some of the myriad bandages along her legs.

title: summoner_(dungeon_and_fighter)
body:
[[dungeon_and_fighter|Dungeon & Fighter]] character. Subclass of the [[Female Mage_(dungeon_and_fighter)|]]. Also known as the Lunar Princess or Eclipse.

Her default appearance has her red hair cut short and swept to her left. She wears a black jacket with a simple one-piece red dress underneath and dark gray stockings with black stripes. Her myriad summons are shrouded in darkness behind her.

As an Eclipse, her short hair has [[antenna_hair|hair antennae]] added to the top of her head (some fan artists alternatively depict it as a sole [[ahoge]]). Her outfit consists of a red jacket with white sleeves, a short red top, black shorts, and white kneesocks.

As a Neo Summoner, she has a longer black jacket, red and black dress, and red thighhighs.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24660710: Default
* !asset #24660711: Eclipse
* !post #5353628: Neo Summoner

title: super_mechagodzilla
body:
An improved version of the [[Mechagodzilla]] that appeared in [[Godzilla vs. Mechagodzilla II]] after combining with the aircraft [[Garuda_(godzilla)]]. Please not despite the English title of the movie, it has nothing to do with [[Mechagodzilla_2]] who is the classic Mechagodzilla rebuilt in [[Terror_of Mechagodzilla]]. Pipeworks' Godzilla game trilogy fell for this confusion as well.

* !asset #32233325
* !asset #32233331
* !asset #32233322

title: mechagodzilla_2
body:
A rebuilt variant of the [[Mechagodzilla]] that appeared in the 1975 Godzilla film [[Terror Of Mechagodzilla]], it looks nearly identical to the one from the 1974 film [[Godzilla_vs._mechagodzilla]] but has MG2 on its arms, duller shine and fewer colors in its eye beams. Not to be confused with the Mechagodzilla that appears in the 1993 film perplexedly named [[Godzilla vs. Mechagodzilla II]] which was a separate continuity and that timeline's first and only Mechagodzilla. Pipeworks' Godzilla game trilogy fell for this confusion as well.

* !asset #32233087

title: martin_(pgr)
body:
Martin is a 'Bionic', a sentient war machine developed by the ARU. Martin is a Bionic based on a [[polar bear]], though the anatomy proportions are modified for bipedal movements. During the event of 'Firn Night', Martin together with [[Nanami (pgr)|]] played a key role in securing the victory for the ARU and Babylonia forces.

Though his name is Martin, Nanami addresses him with a wide variety of names such as and not limited to: Matty, Martini, Morley, Morty.

h4. See also

title: kasuga_mirai
body:
Character in [i][[Idolmaster Million Live!]][/i].
She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] in [[one side up|a left side up]], usually with a [[scrunchie]] and [[hairclip]].  She has [[brown eyes]].
Her pose is striking as she is [[pointing up]] with one hand.

h4. Profile

[quote]
Attribute: Vocal (Million live!) / Princess ([[idolmaster million live! theater days|Theater days]]) / Flower and Dream ([[idolmaster PopLinks|PopLinks]])
Age: 14
Height: 156cm (5'3)
Weight: 42kg (92.6lbs)
BMI: 17.26
BWH: 78-54-77
Birthday: June 28
Blood Type: O
Hobbies: Collecting cute hair clips
Special skill:  Singing
Likes:  Live performances
Birthplace: [[Tokyo (city)|]]
Theme color: Red
CV: [[Yamazaki Haruka]] 
[/quote]

title: lee_(pgr)
body:
Playable character in [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. Voiced by [[Matsuoka Yoshitsugu]].

Member of Gray Raven, a task force that leads the charge in defeating corrupted enemies with the end goal of reclaiming Earth for humanity. Older brother of [[Murray (PGR)|]]. As a construct, he takes on the name Lee which is derived from his real name, Morian.

title: cropped
body:
An image that is a cropped portion of a larger picture. 

It's not uncommon for artists on Twitter to post both the full-size picture and a crop, in order to play around twitter's cropping mechanism. Sometimes the cropped version is of higher resolution than the equivalent portion of the full picture, in which case it makes sense to upload both images. 
Generally, you should make the cropped post the child post, even if it is of higher resolution than the uncropped post.

It is also possible that the full size image is only [[paid reward available|available]] as a [[paid reward]].

h4.See also

* [[duplicate]]
* [[paid reward available]]
* [[third-party edit]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: plague_inc.
body: A real-time strategy simulation game developed and published by Ndemic Creations. In the game, the player takes control of a chosen pathogen that will infect, and eventually annihilate the human population.

title: vshojo
body:
Former [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] company founded in November 2020, headed by TheGunrun and [[MowtenDoo]] (until his departure on May 14th, 2025). Its first members consisted of [[Indie Virtual YouTuber|indie VTubers]] connected to ProjektMelody who had collaborated with one another greatly.

After Ironmouse left the agency on July 21, 2025 while accusing them of withholding Twitch revenue from her, including $500,000 meant for charity, virtually all of their talents announced their own departures within the next two days, including those that had yet to make a formal debut. The company would "shut down":[https://twitter.com/VShojo/status/1948442574722924778] on July 24, 2025 due to lack of funding and controversy.

If any of the members' posts come from before they joined VShojo, or from after they left (if they've continued their activities since leaving), then do not use this tag.

h4. Members

h5. Founding Members (2020/21)

* [[Apricot the Lich]] "Froot" (quit July 24, 2025)
* [[Hime Hajime]] (quit July 22, 2025)
* [[Ironmouse]] "Mouse"/"Mousey" (quit July 21, 2025)
* [[Melody (ProjektMelody)|]] (quit July 22, 2025)
* [[Nyatasha Nyanners]] "Nyan" (quit April 30, 2023)
* [[Silvervale]] "Silver" (quit April 26, 2023)
* [[Zentreya]] "Zen" (quit July 11, 2025)

h5. 2021 Debutant

* [[Vei (vtuber)|]] (quit April 26, 2023)

h5. 2022 Debutants

* [[Amemiya Nazuna]] (quit December 31, 2023)
* [[Haruka Karibu]] (quit July 22, 2025)
* [[Kson]] "[[Souchou]]" (quit July 22, 2025)

h5. 2023 Debutants

* [[General GEEGA]] (quit June 27, 2025)
* [[Henya The Genius]] (quit July 22, 2025)
* [[Kuro Kurenai]] "K9 Kuro" (quit July 22, 2025)
* [[Matara Kan]] "Mata" (quit May 5, 2025)

h5. 2024 Debutants

* [[Akatsuki Hotaru]] (quit July 22, 2025)
* [[Hestia Happiness]] (quit July 22, 2025)
* [[Michi Mochievee]] (quit July 22, 2025)
* [[Okamoto Nagi]] (quit July 22, 2025)
* [[Yutori Peke]] (quit July 22, 2025)

h5. 2025 Debutant

* [[Monarch (AmaLee)|AmaLee]] "Monarch" (quit July 22, 2025)

h5. Unannounced Monster Girl Generation

* [[PiaPi UFO|PiaPi]] (passed audition but declined to move forward with contract)
* [[Tori Oriane]] (voided contract before debut)
* [[Beri (Beribug)|Beribug]] (voided contract before debut)

h5. Unannounced Idol Group

* [[phoebe (vtuber)|Phoebe Chan]] (voided contract before debut)
* [[Mint Fantome]] (voided contract before debut)

h5. Other

* [[Momo Mischief]] (signed contract in 2019 but never debuted)
* [[Camila (Vtuber)|]] (passed audition in 2022 but was never accepted)

h4. Shared Outfits

* [[VShojo Idol Uniform]]

title: circle_arms
body:
[[Ultraman Trigger]]'s signature weapon. It can change its modes to suit his various Type Changes. Its default form is the [b]Multi Sword[/b], which Trigger uses in in Multi Type. The weapon can change into the [b]Power Claw[/b] in Power Type and [b]Sky Arrow[/b] in Sky Type, with each mode having different specializations. It is also capable of drawing out power from GUTS Hyper Keys for finisher attacks.

* Ultraman Wiki: "Circle Arms":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Circle_Arms]

title: hoshino_isamu
body:
One of the main characters of [[Ultraman (1st series)|]].

He is an 11-year old boy who serves as a "special member" of the Science Special Search Party.

After episode 25, he was written out of the show, after his actor suffered a leg injury during a skiing accident.

title: abigail_williams_(fate)
body:
Foreigner-class Servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The eponymous Witch of Salem, she is also known as "The Silver Key" which is a reference to the [[Cthulhu Mythos]]. She first appeared in [[promotional art]] for Epic of Remnant (post #2635525).

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]], worn [[parted bangs|parted]] to both sides and decorated with [[multiple hair bows|multiple]] [[orange bow|orange]] and [[purple bow|purple]] [[hair bow]]s. She wears a [[black dress]] with [[white bloomers]] and an oversized [[black hat|black]] [[witch hat]]. Tends to be depicted in oversized clothes with her [[sleeves past wrists|sleeves past her wrists]], or just [[black panties]] with no bra and ribbons (sometimes butterfly-cut ones) coming from the multiple [[bow]]s on her neck covering her torso a little.

While using her powers, she gets a [[keyhole]] mark on her forehead, [[white skin]] and [[red eyes]] and can attack with [[tentacles]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Oowada Hitomi]]

title: shiratsuyu_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)
body:
The kai/retrofit form of [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Shiratsuyu (Azur Lane)|]]. 

In this form, she gains [[large breasts]] and a significantly mature build over her base guise. Her outfit changes to a [[white shirt|white]] [[double-breasted]] [[crop top]] with a [[grey sailor collar]] and [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[neck ribbon]] (which emphasizes her [[underboob]]s), [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white socks|white kneehighs]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]]. 

Her kai [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces with [[mechanical hands]], with one 12.7 cm twin gun mount on her right and 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her left.

title: melody_lane_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after a [[Camellia]] cultivar.[/tn]

[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Sire:[/td]
[td][[Orfevre (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Grandsire:[/td]
[td][[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Mowen (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Motivator (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Mowen (racehorse)|]]. She is a bay mare with a wide blaze marking that is slanted over the left side of her face, socks on all but her front left leg and is notable for being unusually small as well as being [[Titleholder (racehorse)|]]'s elder sister.

This diminutive thoroughbred is famous for having the record as the JRA's lightest winner of a race - at 338 kg - and usually hovers around 350 kg. Most of her fellow competitors as well as both parents (in their racing years, both were around 450 and 460 kg) are at least a full 100 kg heavier than her. While not a top-level runner, she actually has modest success as a Stayer (a long-distance runner) and is renowned for her exceptional stamina. Her first win was at a 2400 m race, her other wins being above that distance and her only Classics appearance being a respectable 5th place at the Kikuka Sho (3000 m. Two years later, Titleholder would win that race). After a long career running in many of Japan's longest races, Melody Lane retired on December 2024 at age 8 due to a bowed tendon. She returned to Okada Stud to assume broodmare duties.

Unsurprisingly, being an idol horse, she is a popular choice for [[horse girl|original]] [[Umamusume]], often depicted together with her RL sire Orfevre (either in her [[orfevre (old design) (umamusume)|old design]] or in her [[orfevre_(umamusume)|canon version]]) or a umamusume version of Titleholder. She is usually represented this way with brown hair with a wide blaze marking making the left side of her bangs, an ornament based on her namesake flower or a musical note ([i]Melody[/i] Lane) on or around [b]her left ear[/b], and is typically portrayed as much smaller than most other characters. With the eventual presence of her contemporaries in the game, she was finally hinted at as "A particularly small Umamusume" in [[Chrono Genesis (umamusume)|]]' scenario.

Real-life racehorse. A JRA Hall of fame inductee and [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]]'s best friend. He is also known as a successful broodmare sire due to them having great compatibility with [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]]. He is the damsire of [[Dream Journey (racehorse)|]], [[Orfevre (racehorse)|]] and [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]].

His namesake is [[Steve McQueen]], an actor famous in the '60s and the '70s for his many movies involving cars.

In the context of [[Umamusume]], see [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)]].

title: wet_dream
body:
In general, images with someone having or implied to have a lewd [[dreaming|dream]].

Sometimes it's as straightforward as the dream itself being depicted in a [[thought bubble]], but not always. Other signs of a wet dream include [[ejaculation|ejaculating]] while [[sleeping]] for those with a penis. Similarly, a [[female ejaculation]] or general vaginal wetness while sleeping for those with a vagina. May result in [[stained sheets]].

title: police_zaku
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.
 
[b]MS-06-SSP Police Zaku[/b]

A variant of the [[Zaku]] [[Mobile Suit]] that appears in [[Gundam Gquuuuuux]].

Following the events of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]; [[Zeon]] sold off some of their older Zaku units as many were a war excedent following the adoption of new and better MS derived of tecnology obtained from the capture of the [[White Gundam]].

The [[space habitat|colonies]] consisting of the independent Side 6 would modify the Zakus they obtained into a special mobile suit police force in fear of a future [[Zeon]] (or any other) attack.

The police Zaku appears similar to the regular Zaku but with some minor alterations. The most notable of these alterations are its [[blue armor|blue color scheme]] and shoulder-mounted police lights.

title: e-100
body:
A prototype German superheavy tank, intended to be a more standardized version of the Maus. Only its hull was ever completed, though a proposal for its turret existed but failed to materialize. It was supposed to be the largest and most powerful tank in the E-Series, armed with a 128mm gun.

There are also versions with the E-100 Turret, most common is the Krupp (mostly used in [[World Of Tanks]] ) and the Maus turret, both has configurations for a 12.8cm gun and a Howitzer 15cm gun.

The E-100 would later be used on the series of G.W E-100, JgPz E-100 and the dreaded WTF E-100

h4. See also
* [[Geschutzwagen E-100]]
* [[Jagdpanzer E-100]]
* [[Waffentraeger auf E-100]]

title: spirit:_stallion_of_the_cimarron
body:
[b]Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron[/b] (also known as Spirit) is a 2002 American animated Western film produced by [[dreamworks|DreamWorks Animation]]. 

Set in the Old West in the late 19th century, the film follows Spirit, a mustang stallion (voiced by [[Matt Damon]] as a narrator), who is captured during the American Indian Wars by the United States Cavalry; he is eventually freed by a Lakota man named Little Creek with whom he bonds, as well as a mare named Rain.

h4. Characters

* [[Spirit_(spirit:_stallion_of_the_cimarron)|]] (stallion with yellow fur and black hair)
* [[Rain_(spirit:_stallion_of_the_cimarron)|]] (mare with white-brown fur and white hair)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spirit:_Stallion_of_the_Cimarron

title: refined_barzam
body:
A fictional manned military giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RMS-154CII Refined Barzam (Barzam Custom)[/b]

A refined and more capable version of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[Barzam]] [[mobile_suit|MS]]. It is armed with an improved version of the [[Gundam Mk II]]s original [[beam rifle]] and [[shield]].

Tested initially by the defeated Titans, the few remaining units were later used by the [[Earth Federation]].

title: duramente_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]In musical terminology, denotes a passage marked to be played in a bold and firm style. From Italian: "Roughly, coarsely, harshly".[/tn]

[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Sire:[/td]
[td][[King Kamehameha (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Admire Groove (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by King Kamehameha and foaled by [[Admire Groove (racehorse)|]] (a daughter of [[Air Groove (racehorse)|]]), Duramente was a racehorse with an exceptional record (9: 5-4-0, 2 G1 wins) but his career was cut short due to injuries. He was [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]]'s major rival during their classics.

However, what makes him most exceptional is the quality of his offspring. Despite dying unexpectedly due to colitis on August 31, 2021 (he was aged 9) and thus, only having a few years worth of crops, his legacy is already set, thanks to [[Titleholder (racehorse)|]] and [[Stars on Earth (racehorse)|]], assuming they themselves survive long enough in stud.

In the context of [[Umamusume]], the game had to settle with a stand-in NPC ([[Brusquement (Umamusume)|]]) until they could finally score Shadai Group horses, thus finally paving the way for [[Duramente (umamusume)|the real deal]] in Season 3 of the anime.

h5.G1 Winners:

* [[Titleholder (racehorse)|]]: 2021 Kikuka Sho, 2022 Spring Tenno Sho; Takarazuka Kinen
* [[Stars on Earth (racehorse)|]]: 2022 Oka Sho; Oaks
* [[Valle de la Luna (racehorse)|]]: 2022 JBC Ladies'Classic (Jpn1); 2023 Kashiwa Kinen (Jpn1)
* [[Dura Erede (racehorse)|]]: 2022 Hopeful Stakes (Active)
* [[Liberty Island (racehorse)|]]: 2022 Hanshin Juvenile Fillies; 2023 Triple Tiara (Oka Sho, Oaks and Shuka Sho) (Deceased)
* [[Champagne Color (racehorse)|]]: 2023 NHK Mile Cup (Active)
* [[Durezza (racehorse)|]]: 2023 Kikuka Sho (Active)
* [[Icon Tailor (racehorse)|]]: 2022 JBC Ladies'Classic (Jpn1)
* [[Lugal (racehorse)|]]: 2024 Sprinters Stakes (Active)

title: barzam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RMS-154 Barzam[/b]

A low-cost mass production redesigned [[one-eyed|mono-eye]] variant of the [[Gundam Mk II]] developed to replace the [[Marasai]]. Despite the reduced price, the type was extremely capable, and it was seen by many as the last true flagship multi-role [[mobile suit|MS]] of the [[Titans (gundam)|]].

h4. Related MS development

* [[Refined Barzam]]
* [[Barzam II]]
* [[BAR-GM]]

title: gundam_mk_ii
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RX-178 Gundam Mk. II[/b]

A revised and much improved design of the original [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]]. While in testing under the [[Titans_(gundam)|]], the sinister looking dark blue colored prototypes were stolen by [[Quattro Bajeena]] and the [[AEUG]] with the help of [[Kamille Bidan]], who went on to pilot the sole surviving unit before switching to his own designed mobile suit,  the [[Zeta Gundam_(mobile_suit)|]]. The unit was later repainted white while at the service of the AEUG (to evoke the iconic look of the legendary original Gundam from [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]).

It was later piloted by [[Emma Sheen]] during the Gryps Conflict, and various different members of the [[Gundam Team]] during the events of [[Gundam ZZ]] (First Neo Zeon War), more prominently [[Elle Vianno]].

h4. Related development
* [[Gundam TR-1 Hazel]]
* [[Barzam]]

h4. See also
* [[Super Gundam]]
* [[G-Defenser]]

* [[Full Armor Gundam Mk II]]
* [[Gundam Mk II Banagher Links Custom]]

title: gundam_tr-1_hazel
body:
A fictional manned combat giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Advance of Zeta]].

[b]RX-121 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel][/b]

A limited production experimental [[mobile suit]] developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] for their suppression and destruction of [[Zeon]] remnants. It took many design philosophies from its ancestor, the [[Gundam Alex]], such as purgable [[reactive armor]] as well as two large thrusters and defensive features dubbed "shield boosters". 

It was developed from the [[GM Quel]] and used primarily by the [[titans_test_team_(gundam)|Titans Test Team]]. In terms of performance it was very in line with another predecessor, the [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]]. Testing and several modifications on the base unit provided the Titans with precious data to later develop the far more advanced Gundam MK II.

h4.Related development
* [[Gundam TR-6 Hazel II]]
* [[Hazel Custom Gundam]]
* [[Gundam MK II]]

title: gm_quel
body:
A fictional military manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam 0083]].

[b]RGM-79Q GM Quel[/b]

The first [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the fledgling [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. Taking the fast but unimpressive [[GM Custom]] as a base, the unit was simplified to reduce costs and received upgraded beam weapons that were unavailable to previous GM variants. 

It served diligently -if unspectacularly- until it was ultimately replaced by the [[Hizack]] in frontline service.

h4. Related development
* [[Gundam TR-1 Hazel]]

[b]Haru Urara[/b] is a Japanese racehorse famous for an incredibly long consecutive loss streak (0 wins across 113 races). 

She went viral in July 2025 after an internet campaign was started to donate fresh grass for her to eat. She passed away two months later in September 2025 at age 29.

Oriental Art was a chestnut mare with a prominent white blaze down her face. She also had a white "sock" marking on her left hindleg. Her overall appearance greatly resembled that of her more well-known son, [[Orfevre (Racehorse)|]].

Oriental Art was best known for being the dam of [[Orfevre (Racehorse)|]] and [[Dream Journey (racehorse)|]].

title: unmei_no_makimodoshi
body:
A 2022 [[science fiction]] manga by Kimura Fuuta, serialized in CoroCoro. An anime adaptation was announced in 2025.

The story revolves around a secret order of time travelers tasked with saving people from unfortunate deaths, typically by utilizing a special prosthetic right eye known as a "Retry Eye" to "retry" and undo any mistakes until their target(s) are saved and alive. It primarily focuses on Chrono, a young "Rewinder" seeking to become strong enough to tackle "Case 999", an impossible case that involves the death of his sister and the heavy involvement of a notorious organization hellbent on preventing him from solving it.

h4. Characters

title: mystic_square
body:
東方怪綺談 ("Touhou Kaikidan") ~ Mystic Square
("Fantastic Eastern Tales of Romance")

Fifth game of the [[Touhou]] series and the last for the [[Touhou (PC-98)|PC-98]] generation - released 30 December 1998 - before going into a 4-year hiatus.

For no apparent reason, demons and youkai overran [[Gensokyo]] once more, this time from a cave leading to [[Makai (touhou)|]]. [[Hakurei Reimu (PC-98)|]], [[Kirisame Marisa (PC-98)|]], [[Mima (touhou)|]] and [[Kazami Yuuka (PC-98)|]], each with their own agenda, decide to enter the cave in search of the root of the problem.

The game also marks the first appearance of [[Alice Margatroid (PC-98)|]], Stage 3 and Extra Stage Boss and later a recurring playable character for the Windows generation.

h4. Characters

h6. Playable

* [[Hakurei Reimu (PC-98)|]]
* [[Kirisame Marisa (PC-98)|]]
* [[Mima (touhou)|]]
* [[Kazami Yuuka (PC-98)|]]

h6. Enemies

* Stage 1 Midboss: [[Wayousei (touhou)|]]
* Stage 1 Boss: [[Sara (Touhou)|]]
* Stage 2 Boss: [[Louise (touhou)|]]
* Stage 3 Boss: [[Alice Margatroid (PC-98)|]]
* Stage 4 Boss: [[Yuki (Touhou)|]] and [[Mai (Touhou)|]]
* Stage 5 Midboss: [[Ayana (touhou)|Ayana]]
* Stage 5 Boss: [[Yumeko (touhou)|]]
* Final Stage Boss: [[Shinki (touhou)|]]
* Extra Stage Boss: [[Alice Margatroid (PC-98)|]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Mystic Square":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Mystic_Square

title: panorama
body:
A wide-angle view of an area, broader than can be seen in one glance by the human eye. Typically produces a distorted image wherein some or all straight lines appear partially or completely curved, especially along the longer axis of the image.
External tools can be used to view these images properly.

If an image contains the full 360° view of an area, then also add the [[360_panorama]] tag.

h4. See also
* [[360_panorama]]
* [[fisheye]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

h4. External Links
* https://renderstuff.com/tools/360-panorama-web-viewer/

title: fujiwara_chika
body:
One of the main characters of [[Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai ~Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen~]]. She is an air-headed and energetic daughter of a politician and a member of a student council. She often exploited her family connection to get away from breaking various school rules in favor of herself and her friends.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She usually wears a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]] and the [[Shuuchiin Academy School Uniform]].

[[Chikattochikachika (kaguya-sama wa kokurasetai)|]] Outfit: [[red headwear|red]] [[newsboy cap]] and [[magnifying glass]].

She is voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]] in the anime.

Her younger sister is [[Fujiwara Moeha]], and her older sister is [[Fujiwara Toyomi]].

h4. See Also

* https://kaguyasama-wa-kokurasetai.fandom.com/wiki/Chika_Fujiwara

title: atmospheric_perspective
body:
A technique to show distance, typically employed in large outdoor areas. It results in a reduction in contrast and clarity due to the atmosphere scattering more and more light as the distance between the object and the viewer increases. [[Haze]] can increase the intensity of the effect.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Aerial perspective":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aerial_perspective]

title: jeff_hanneman
body: Jeff Hanneman was an American musician, best known for being a guitarist and founding member for the band [[Slayer (band)|Slayer]]. He composed both lyrics and music for each Slayer album, up until his death in 2013. He died of liver failure on May 2, 2013 at the age of 49.

title: chaos_elfilis
body:
The final/"Soul" form of [[Fecto Elfilis]], born from absorbing some of [[Morpho Knight]]’s DNA. Has two forms of its own: its normal form, now with a pirmarily white and red color scheme; and a a large, amorphous orb reminiscent of [[Drawcia Soul]].

[spoiler]In [[star-crossed world|the Ultimate Cup Z EX]], it takes a page from [[magolor_soul|Magolor Soul's]] book and gains a heavily souped-up moveset, with the addition of crystals to many of its attacks as well as summoning replicas of Beast Pack bosses in its second phase.[/spoiler]

title: moriya_suwako
body:
The "Epitome of Native Gods" (土着神の頂点). Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]] [i][[Mountain of Faith]][/i] and later a playable character in [i][[touhou_hisoutensoku|Hisoutensoku]][/i]. 

Mountain ([[frog]]) goddess and original patron deity of the Moriya Shrine before losing it to [[Yasaka Kanako]], but has remained a fixture in the shrine. She has the power to create earth. Direct ancestor of the shrine's miko, [[Kochiya Sanae]]. Suwako joined Sanae and Kanako upon moving into [[Gensokyo]], although she is less troubled by the waning faith of people from the outside world than the latter two.

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blonde hair]] with two [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]]s and [[yellow eyes]]. Her [[brown hat]] has almost become an entity of its own in fan art, due to the leering eyes on top of it. Her outfit is a [[white shirt]] with a [[turtleneck shirt|turtleneck]] and [[long sleeves]] under a [[purple vest]] with a [[skirt set|matching]] [[purple skirt]] with the occasional [[frog print]]. While a lot of fan art depicts her with [[white thighhighs]], she normally wears [[white socks]] and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Yasaka Kanako]] - fellow goddess of the Moriya Shrine
* [[Kochiya Sanae]] - descendant and shrine maiden
* [[Pyonta]] - Suwako's hat. Only use when hat acting independently of Suwako.
* [[Moriya's Iron Rings]] - Suwako's weapons
* [[Mishaguji]] - Suwako's underlings

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Suwako Moriya":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Suwako_Moriya

title: charles_ii_of_spain
body: [b]Charles II of Spain[/b] (6 November 1661 – 1 November 1700) was the last Habsburg ruler of the Spanish Empire during the late 17th century. As a result of the Habsburgs constant inbreeding within their family to prevent rival noble families from gaining their power, Charles was born with several illiness which he inherited from his ancestors, including the Habsburg Jaw, which made him weak, mentally unstable and was unable to sire an heir. His death led to the War of the Spanish Succession (1701 to 1714) between France and Austria and their allies over who would rule Spain.

title: jeff_bogard
body:
