h4. External links

* "SNK Wiki: Jeff Bogard":https://snk.fandom.com/wiki/Jeff_Bogard

title: andy_bogard
body:
A main character of [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series, and [[brothers|younger brother]] to [[Terry Bogard]]. He is one of the co-protagonists of the greater Fatal Fury series alongside Terry and his best friend [[Joe Higashi]].

Andy is commonly seen wearing some version of a ninja oufit; he typically wears a white shinobi shozoko with red [[gloves]] and [[belt]]. His outfit mostly sports a [[fire]] design. He has [[blue eyes]], and [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] that is occasionally tied in a [[ponytail]] but is normally [[hair down|worn down]]. In [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], Andy cuts his hair [[short hair|short]], just like his brother.

Andy is a [[ninja]], trained from a young age in Koppo, Hakkyokuseiken, and Shiranui-ryuu Ninjutsu alongside native heir to the style [[Shiranui Mai]], in order to work alongside his brother Terry to avenge the death of their father [[Jeff Bogard]] at the hands of South Town's crime lord [[Geese Howard]]. Compared to laid-back Terry and jokester Joe, Andy is the serious straight man of the trio, honing his skill to a razor's edge with a killer instinct that lets him defeat foes that even give Terry and Joe a hard time. His singular blind spot is his brother Terry, whom he treats as a rival; he gets too excited fighting him and tends to lose against him.

Mai is Andy's lover and, at least as of FF:CotW, is engaged to her. Historically, Mai tended to move the relationship a bit too quickly for Andy's liking, a point played for humor.

As of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]], he and Mai are training a young Shiranui-ryuu disciple, [[Hokutomaru]].

title: terry_bogard
body:
Main character of the [[Fatal Fury]] series and a regular in [[The King of Fighters]]. His [i]nom de guerre[/i] is the "(Legendary) Hungry Wolf".

Terry is an American street fighter, trained in Hakkyokuseiken and a mish-mash of various martial arts. He is the [[brothers|elder brother]] to [[Andy Bogard]] and friends with [[Joe Higashi]], [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]], and [[Blue Mary]] among many others, mortal enemy of [[Geese Howard]] - the South Town crime lord who murdered his and Andy's father [[Jeff Bogard]], and adoptive father and mentor to Geese's bastard son [[Rock Howard]]. He is one of the biggest folk heroes of South Town, a fictional coastal American metropolis inspired by Miami, Florida.

Terry is one of [[SNK]]'s chief ambassadors, appearing in numerous cross-overs and promotions on top of being an all-around very popular character and important to the landscape of video games. For example, he is commonly cited as the primary inspiration for [[Guilty Gear]]'s [[Sol Badguy]]. He achieved his [[meme|memetic]] status in part through his "engrish" quotes said during gameplay.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3618604: Classic Terry (pict. [[Super Smash Bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]])
* !post #6191180: Time-skip Terry
* !post #3211344: [[SNK Heroines: Tag Team Frenzy|Heroine]] Terry

He mostly wears a red leather [[vest]] that has a [[star (symbol)|]] on the back, a [[baseball cap]] that matches his vest with the words [[fatal fury cap|Fatal Fury]] on it, a white T-shirt (later replaced by a [[tank top]] of the same color), blue [[jeans]], [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]], and [[fingerless gloves]]. His [[blonde hair]] is mainly done in a [[ponytail]].

From [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]] onward, Terry [[short hair|cut his hair]] and [[hair down|wears it down]] without his cap, and he pairs a brown [[bomber jacket]] and loafers with his jeans and gloves.

* [[Power Wave]]
* [[Rising Tackle]]

title: naka_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Naka[/i], third and final of the [i]Sendai[/i]-class.

Released in the [i]Crimson Echoes[/i] event on January 2019.

(See post #3363252 for details)
In the game, she has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] and [[yellow eyes]], with [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail|tail]], and wearing the same prevailing style as her sisters: a mix of traditional [[Japanese clothes]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], and white [[thighhighs]].
Her rig carries two 14 cm single guns and two 61 cm twin torpedo mounts, one gun and torpedo mount on each side.

In real life, she was the third out of a planned seven-member class but she was the last one completed due to Washington Naval Treaty restrictions. Even then, she took longer to complete as her original hull was damaged beyond repair in an earthquake in 1923 and had to be rebuilt from scratch. At the start of the war, she led the Fourth Destroyer Squadron and operated alongside her sister [[Jintsuu (Azur Lane)|]] and the Second Destroyer Squadron. While in an operation in the Indian Ocean on April 1, 1942, she was hit by a torpedo from a US submarine that put her out of action for a year. She then operated under different commands before being sunk alongside [[Agano (Azur Lane)|]] in a raid on Truk in February 1944.

title: sendai_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Sendai[/i], name ship of her class.

In the game, she is depicted having [[blonde hair]], [[yellow eyes]], and the same [[fox girl]] attribute shared to her class. She also wears a mix of traditional [[Japanese clothes]] and a modern [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]] with a red fringe.
Her rig contains two 14 cm single mounts and two twin 61 cm torpedo launchers, one gun and torpedo mount per side. She increases her 14 cm guns upon [[retrofit (azur lane)|]].

In real life, she was the flagship of the Third Destroyer Squadron and was heavily committed to combat operations in the Dutch East Indies and Guadalcanal. Ultimately, she was sunk in a night action in Empress Augusta Bay in early November 1943.

For her retrofit form, see her [[Sendai (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]

title: suruga_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Suruga[/i]. Character designed by [[fuzichoco]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]]. First appeared in the game's portable console spinoff game [[Azur Lane: Crosswave]] before being made playable in the original mobile version during the Swirling Cherry Blossoms event of December 2019.

She wears a white [[military uniform]], [[bike shorts]], a [[single leg pantyhose]] on her left and a [[garter straps|garter strap]] [[single thighhigh]] on her right, and a long [[white coat]] with an [[aiguillette]] and [[epaulettes]]. The coat also has the [[Sakura Empire (emblem)|Sakura Empire insignia]] on the left side. The rank insignia of her coat means "Vice Admiral" in the IJN, reflective of the real-life rank held by her designer, Yuzuru Hiraga. She is also seen with a pre-1935 IJN military sword (guntou) attached to her belt on her left.

Her rig contains five 41 cm twin mounts: two on her back, one on her left, two on her right. Like other IJN shipgirls, she also has an animalistic trait: [[horns]] with [[hair flower]]s on them.

Historically, her name was never finalized before she was cancelled in November 1923 to comply with the Washington Naval Treaty. Thus, she is also known in records as "Ship Number 11".

title: kii_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the name ship and lead ship of the [i]Kii[/i]-class battleships in [[Azur Lane]]. First appeared in the [i]Dreamwaker's Butterfly[/i] event in September 2020. Character design by [[Gujianshaonu]], voiced by Kaneko Sayaka.

She has [[absurdly long hair|really long]] [[black hair]] with [[fox ears]] on them, tied in a long [[ponytail]]. She is shown wearing a [[red kimono]] in [[hadanugi dousa]] style, with her [[sarashi]] exposed, and black [[thighhighs]] and [[rudder footwear]] complete her outfit. Plates of traditional samurai armor are also shown attached to the kimono. She also carries a large [[katana]] to her back.

Her rig is starkly different from her sister [[Suruga (Azur Lane)|]]'s, with a more mechanized appearance while keeping an identical layout of five 41 cm twin mounts. Unlike Suruga's, she has her 12 cm heavy AA guns mounted on her rig, to her left. Also of note is the [[torii]] mounted to the back.

She bears a striking similarity to [[Ushiwakamaru (Fate)|]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]], as noted when she was first revealed.

Historically ordered in 1921, the Washington Naval Treaty halted all development for the Kii-class before they were formally cancelled, Suruga and Oumi (Ship nos. 11 and 12, respectively) in 1923, followed by Kii and Owari in 1924.

title: glory_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she can be found sitting on a [[bench]] above Mondstadt's main plaza. 

Glory is [[blind]] and is also in love with the knight [[Godwin (genshin impact)|]], awaiting his "return" from Grand Master [[Varka (genshin impact)|]]'s expedition. She is the adoptive daughter of [[Grace (genshin impact)|]] and the adoptive older sister of [[Timmie (genshin impact)|]].

Glory has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[bandages over eyes|bandages over her eyes]]. She wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[neck ribbon]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[brown belt]], [[puffy shorts|puffy]] [[blue shorts|blue]] [[short shorts]], [[white socks]] and a pair of [[blue boots]].

title: grace_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she is a [[nun]] in Mondstadt's Church of Favonius and can be found leading a prayer group in front of the [[statue]] of [[Barbatos (genshin impact)|]]. 

Grace serves as a motherly figure to [[child|children]] in Mondstadt who lack parental figures or were abandoned. She is the adoptive mother of both [[Glory (genshin impact)|]] and [[Timmie (genshin impact)|]].

Grace has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears the standard Church of Favonius nun uniform, consisting of a [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress]] with [[juliet sleeves]], a [[white hat]] with a [[latin cross]] on it, a [[white veil]], [[brown pantyhose]] and a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

title: wuthering_heights
body:
An 1847 novel by English novelist "Emily Brontë":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emily_Brontë detailing the turbulent tale of two families, the Earnshaws and Lintons. Influenced by Romanticism and Gothic fiction, Wuthering Heights is widely considered one of the greatest English novels of all time.

title: one_eye_closed
body:
Having one eye closed. This can be for any reason.

* If the tongue is sticking upwards, it is also [[;q]].
* If the tongue is sticking downwards, it is also [[;p]].
* If the character also has [[:3|cat mouth]], it's also [[;3]].
* If the mouth is [[:o|open in a round shape]], it's also [[;o]].
* If the character is [[smile|smiling]] with a [[closed mouth]], it's also [[;)]].
* If the character is smiling with an [[open mouth]], it is also [[;D]].
* If the closed eye is drawn like one side of [[>_<]], it is also [[>_o]].
* If the eye is closed involuntarily, as a result of surprise, pain, or embarrassment, it is often a [[wince]] as well.

h4. Examples

* !post #9000000

h4. See also

* [[closed eyes]]
* [[winking (animated)]]
* [[Tag Group:Eyes tags]]

title: cirno
body:
"The Small Ice Fairy"

Debuted as the Stage 2 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later a recurring playable character. She has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[ice wings]], and wears a [[blue dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]]. She appears in [[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]] as a playable character, "[[Tanned Cirno]]."

An ice fairy living in the [[Misty Lake]], near the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]]. A relatively weak fighter, but nevertheless claims to be the strongest of all (somewhat justified, as fairies are low-tier generic enemies in the series). One of her hobbies is [[frozen|freezing]] [[frog|frogs]] and watching them thaw (a third of which ends up shattering), leading doujins to portray her at odds with the frog-themed goddess [[Moriya Suwako]].

Her large ego and childish incompetence earned her the nickname "[[circled 9|⑨]]" (pronounced "maru kyuu"/"nine-ball"), based on an "elements of play" screenshot from the game manual of [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]] in which she was labelled 「9.バカ」 ("baka"/"idiot"). Another contributing factor to her portrayal as an idiot is her [[Icicle Fall]] spell card from Embodiment of Scarlet Devil, which (on Easy difficulty only) fails to hit a "safe zone" directly beneath/in front of her. Doujins also portray her as de facto leader of [[Team 9 (touhou)|]], a posse of childish low-tier Touhou characters.

In Russian she is known as [i]Сырно[/i] (Sɨrno), which literally translates as "cheesy" (in adverb form). In Finnish she is known as [i]Sirkku[/i] (post #673220).

h4. Appearance

* !post #6475070
* !post #3276495

h4. See also

* [[Circled 9]] (⑨)
* [[Cirno Day]] (9th September)
* [[Cirno-nee]], an [[aged up]], much more mature rendition
* [[Advent Cirno]], a series depicting her in the style of [[Cloud Strife]] of [[Final Fantasy VII]]
* [[Achi Cirno]], a fire-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Ikazu Cirno]], a lightning-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Mizu Cirno]], a water-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Hapa Cirno]], a leaf-themed [[alternate element]]
* [[Tanned Cirno]], as she appears in [[Hidden Star In Four Seasons]]
* [[Nineball=Cirno]], a [[M.U.G.E.N]] character which changes Cirno's color palette to match [[Armored Core]]'s [[Nineball Seraph]]
* pool #1567: Cirno - ⑨⑨⑨x⑨⑨⑨ (Cirno images with dimensions exactly 999x999)
* pool #4616: Cirno Is Not So ⑨ (Cirno portrayed as smarter or cleverer than usual)

title: cael_anselm_(book_of_tales)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]]’s [[Cael Anselm]]’s [[official alternate costume]]s in the [i]Book of Tales[/i] event series. 

* In [i]Book of Tales[/i], he’s based after the [[The Snow Queen (Character)|titular queen]] in [[The Snow Queen]], wearing a [[blue coat]] and [[pointed crown]]. 
* In [i]Book of Tales II[/i], he has two versions based after [[The Narrator (Le Petit Prince)|the Aviator]] (wearing [[aviator goggles]] and [[high ponytail]]) and the [[Fox (Le Petit Prince)|]] ([[fox boy]] with a [[flower brooch]]) respectively in [[Le Petit Prince]].

title: cael_anselm_(deimortem_era)
body:
[[Lovebrush Chronicles]]’s [[Cael Anselm]]’s “counterpart” in the Ark World. His real identity is MA-031-707, an [[android]] mass-produced by the Infinite Empire based after the real Cael.

He wears [[white jacket]] and [[white pants|pants]], as well as a [[white cape|white]] [[side cape]]. He often uses a [[whip]] and is most associated with [[bird]].

title: broken_vessel_(hollow_knight)
body: A boss in [[Hollow Knight]], found in Ancient Basin. A husk animated by infection, it bears a striking resemblance to the player character.

title: zote
body:
A recurring character in [[Hollow Knight]], [b]Zote[/b] (a.k.a. [b]Zote the Mighty[/b]) is a traveler who, despite his claims of being a "Knight of Great Renown", regularly requires the [[Knight (hollow knight)|]] to bail him out of dangerous situations.
h4. See also
* [[Grey Prince Zote]]

title: mantis_lord_(hollow_knight)
body: A trio of NPCs/optional bosses in [[Hollow Knight]]. Rulers of the [[praying mantis|Mantis]] Village, they guard the main entrance to Deepnest within, requiring the [[Knight (hollow knight)|]] to defeat them in combat to prove their strength and be allowed through.

title: white_lady_(hollow_knight)
body: Lore character in [[Hollow Knight]]. [spoilers]Wife of the [[Pale King (hollow knight)|]] and mother of both the [[Knight (hollow knight)|]] [[hollow knight (character)|and]] [[broken vessel (hollow knight)|their]] [[greenpath vessel (hollow knight)|fellow]] [[deepnest vessel (hollow knight)|vessels]], before the start of the game she sealed herself away both out of shame for her actions and to suppress her desire to breed[/spoilers].

title: pale_king_(hollow_knight)
body: Lore character in [[Hollow Knight]]. The [b]Pale King[/b] is one of the higher beings of Hallownest [spoilers]and the father of [[Hornet (hollow knight)|]], [[knight (hollow knight)|the player character]], and the [[Hollow Knight (character)|]], the latter two as part of a plan to contain the [[Radiance (hollow knight)|]] and her infection[/spoilers].

title: monomon_(hollow_knight)
body: A major NPC in [[Hollow Knight]]. [b]Monomon the Teacher[/b] is one of the three Dreamers [spoilers]and [[Quirrel]]'s former mentor, who provided him with a [[mask]] in her likeness as protection when she became a Dreamer[/spoilers].

title: lurien_(hollow_knight)
body: A major NPC in [[Hollow Knight]]. [b]Lurien the Watcher[/b] is one of the three Dreamers, who formerly watched over the City of Tears through his [[telescope]].

title: herrah_(hollow_knight)
body:
Major NPC in [[Hollow Knight]]. [b]Herrah the Beast[/b] is queen of Deepnest's [[Spider]] Tribe and one of the three Dreamers.
[spoilers]She is also the mother of [[Hornet (hollow knight)|]], as part of a deal she made with the [[Pale King (hollow knight)|]] in exchange for becoming a Dreamer[/spoilers].

title: seer_(hollow_knight)
body: NPC in [[Hollow Knight]]. [b]The Seer[/b] is a [[moth]] who grants the [[Knight (hollow knight)|]] the Dream Nail and helps them awaken it when provided with Essence. She is the last of the Moth Tribe [spoilers]and is implied to still worship the [[Radiance (hollow knight)|]][/spoilers].

title: knight_(hollow_knight)
body:
Main character and controllable protagonist of the game [[Hollow Knight]]. A genderless being, [spoiler]child of the [[Pale King (Hollow Knight)|Pale King]] and the [[White Lady (Hollow Knight)|White Lady]], sibling of [[Hornet (Hollow Knight)|Hornet]] and the [[Hollow Knight (character)|Hollow Knight]], and born of Void.[/spoiler] Initially found wandering outside the kingdom of Hallownest, they return to uncover its story and the mysteries it hides.

h4. See also

* [[Shade (Hollow Knight)]]

title: yuki_miku_(2024)
body:
冬のごちそうVer. / [i]Winter Feast Ver.[/i]

The 2024 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest for this year was ごちそう (feast) showing the imagery of Hokkaido winter with the winner being [[shiro_(a923808254)|shiro]]'s design with a [[soup curry]] theme.

Her design has a [[sepia]] palette. She wears a [[brown kimono]] with [[white apron]], [[white bow]], and [[fork hair ornament|fork]]/[[spoon hair ornament]]. Her apron is adorned with [[button badge]]s of the common ingredients for soup curry: [[hardboiled egg]], [[carrot]], [[lotus root]], [[green bell pepper|green]] [[bell pepper]], and [[squash]].

Her theme song is [[Happy Cheat Day (vocaloid)|]] by rerulili, with arrangement by tepe, mastering by kagomeP, animation by [[kawa (ricopin35)|]], and movie by [[nihe (niheranone)|]].

Her fan nickname is Soup Curry-chan.

title: razor_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable character from [[Genshin Impact]], he lives with a [[wolf]] pack in Wolvendom after being abandoned by his parents at a young age. The whereabouts of his [[Razor's Mother (genshin impact)|mother]] and [[Razor's Father (genshin impact)|father]] are currently unknown.

A good-natured and honest person, Razor loves his wolf pack as a family and refers to them as "Lupical". Despite encountering few people in Wolvendom due to it's reputation, he considers the few he meets as friends and is even willing to protect them from danger if necessary. He has very keen senses and is highly agile, though he finds speaking troublesome and only speaks in short phrases and words. Razor is good friends with [[Bennett (genshin impact)|]] and also [[Klee (genshin impact)|]], as he always manages to fix her disasters. 

Abandoned by his parents at a young age, Razor was raised by [[Andrius (genshin impact)|Boreas]] and his wolf pack in Wolvendom before he met Grand Master [[Varka (genshin impact)|]] who gave him his name and taught him how to wield a sword. Varka later brought Razor to [[Mondstadt City|Mondstadt]] which allowed him to slowly integrate with humans again through the help of his teacher [[Lisa (genshin impact)|]]. Lisa also taught him how to harness his elemental energy.

Razor has [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] with bangs hanging [[hair between eyes|between his eyes]], [[antenna hair]], [[red eyes]] and has [[scar]]s on his [[scar on cheek|cheek]] and [[scar on arm|arms]]. He wears a [[brown shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] and [[tassel]]s, a [[brown coat|brown]] [[hooded coat|hooded]] [[sleeveless coat]] with his [[hood up]], [[brown gloves|brown]] [[partially fingerless gloves]], [[green pants]], a [[brown belt]] and a pair of [[black boots]]. He has a [[bone necklace]] around his neck, an [[arm strap]] on his right arm and [[bandages]] on his [[bandaged arm|left arm]]. His [[vision (genshin impact)|]] is worn on his back. Razor's vision element is Electro and he wields a [[greatsword|claymore]] in battle.

Voiced by Todd Haberkorn in English, [[Uchiyama Kouki]] in Japanese and Zhou Shuai in Chinese.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4729945: Default

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Razor":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Razor

title: harusaki_nodoka_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s staff [[Harusaki Nodoka]].

As designed, she sports [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and dark [[pink eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|buttoned]] [[white shirt]], a [[green cardigan]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]] typical of an [[office lady]] type, [[pantyhose]], and [[high heels]]. She also wears a pink-colored [[lanyard]] that holds her [[ID card]] with her portrait and name on it as well as a [[frog]] [[charm (object)|accessory]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5339673: Profile

title: harusaki_nodoka
body:
A [[hololive]] staff member and [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] who joined on April 1, 2022. Designed by [[Amagai Tarou]].

On May 7, 2025, she was appointed as hololive production's official announcer under holoAN (holoAnnounce).

On September 5, 2025, she "announced":[https://twitter.com/harusakinodoka/status/1963769053769560512] that she would leave hololive at the end of September.

As designed, she sports [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and dark [[pink eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|buttoned]] [[white shirt]], a [[green cardigan]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]] typical of an [[office lady]] type, [[pantyhose]], and [[high heels]]. She also wears a pink-colored [[lanyard]] that holds her [[ID card]] with her portrait and name on it as well as a [[frog]] [[charm (object)|accessory]].

She also has a [[mole on neck|mole on her neck]], although the official art makes it hard to spot from a distance.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5339673: [[Harusaki Nodoka (1st costume)|Default]]
* !post #9605840: [[Harusaki Nodoka (Holonatsu Paradise)|holoNatsu Paradise]]

title: shiroko_terror_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Similar in appearance to [[Shiroko (blue archive)|]]. Also goes by the name of "Anubis".

[spoiler]A version of Shiroko who remains the sole survivor of Abydos High School, exposed to Chroma by the Nameless Priests, which also altered her physical appearance. Shiroko would go on to serve the Nameless Priests directly under the protection of [[Phrenapates (blue archive)|]], until the main timeline's Sensei infiltrated the Ark of Atrahasis, leading to its subsequent destruction. In Volume 1 Chapter 3, Shiroko was summoned by [[Plana (blue archive)|]] to assist in subduing [[Hoshino Terror (blue archive)|Hoshino Terror]], whose mental state began to spiral similarly to hers.

As of the end of Volume 1 Chapter 3, Shiroko has now been appointed as a member of the Abydos Student Council, and her Halo has slowly begun to heal, now that she's since let go of the guilt of losing her friends.[/spoiler]

She uses a [[SIG SG550]] [[assault rifle]] with a [[SIG P220/P226]] [[handgun]] as a sidearm. [spoiler]She additionally wielded the weapons of the deceased [[Foreclosure Task Force (blue archive)|Foreclosure Task Force]], but has since discarded them as a sign that she's begun to move on.[/spoiler]

Being a grown-up version of Shiroko, Shiroko*Terror has [[very long hair|longer and messier]] [[grey hair]] that's brighter than Shiroko. Her body is also more developed, being slightly taller and having [[large breasts|larger breasts]] and [[thick thighs|fuller thighs]]. Shiroko*Terror wears a pitch [[black dress]] with [[wide sleeves]] that shows her [[cleavage]] and legs, [[black choker]], and a [[thigh holster]] that [[skindentation|worn tightly around her left leg]].

Voiced by: [[Ogura Yui]]
Original artist: [[mx2j]]

title: spongebob_reading_two_pages_at_once_(meme)
body: SpongeBob Reading Two Pages at Once, also known as Cross-Eyed SpongeBob, refers to an object labeling meme format based on a still image of [[SpongeBob Squarepants]] attempting to read two book pages at once, with each of his eyes looking at a different page. Starting in August 2018, the format gained notable popularity online, used to express a desire to do accomplish two things at once without choosing between them.

title: protocol_droid
body: In the [[Star Wars]] universe, a protocol droid was a droid whose job was to aid sentients with their etiquette and relations with each other in the galaxy. They often dealt with event planning, etiquette, translation, and problem solving. Typically 1.67 meters tall and 75 kg in weight,protocol droids came in many shapes and sizes, although most were humanoid in form.

title: furry_and_animal
body:
[[Furry]] characters co-existing with normal, non-anthropomorphic [[animal]]s - an infamous example being [[Goofy]] and [[Pluto (disney)|]]. 

Coincidental background wildlife such as bugs and most birds do not by themselves qualify, unless featured with anthropomorphic characters of the same species. It also does not apply to canonically anthropomorphic [[Pokemon (creature)|]] such as [[Lucario]] being pictured with a non-humanoid Pokemon.

The characters also have to be interacting or at least existing in the same space, not simply being drawn on the same canvas.

Sometimes humorously focused on, especially in the case of a furry character having a [[pet]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8127199
* !post #7843821

h4. See also

* [[person and animalization]]
* [[creature and personification]]

h4. External links

* "TV Tropes: Furry Confusion":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FurryConfusion

title: lacrima_the_crimson_tears
body:
A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]]. Lacrima is the companion of [[Fiendsmith Engraver]] and one of the demons bound under his magical contract. She was spared by Engraver after pleading for mercy, and later became his closest ally despite the former's initial hatred against demons.

She appears as a [[blonde hair|blonde-haired]] [[demon girl]] with [[red eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[red dress]] with [[cleavage cutout]]. True to her epithet, she is almost always seen with a pink tear-like liquid flowing from her eyes, which is tagged as [[runny makeup]] on Danbooru.

In fanart, Lacrima is frequently depicted as a loyal [[gyaru]] girlfriend of Engraver, who tends to react to the latter's display of affection with either nonchalance or exasperation.
other_names: 紅涙の魔ラクリモーサ

title: mint_fantome
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] who is a [[ghost]] [[maid]].

Her initial streaming run was from July 2020 to April 2021; after a hiatus of exactly 3 years, she returned to streaming in April 2024. Originally illustrated by [[kgr]], on Halloween 2024, she debuted her new model (dubbed 3.0) illustrated by [[Ayamy]] and rigged by [[Cillia]], which largely resembles her previous 2.0 model (albeit with a style change due to her new illustrator).

She has [[short hair]] with a [[white hair|white]]-[[green hair|green]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[wavy hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her current default hairstyle consists of a [[two side up]] held with small blue bows and decorated with a [[triangular headpiece]], a [[maid headdress]] and an [[x hair ornament|x-shaped]] [[hairclip]]. She received [[pointy ears]] with her 3.0 model.

When streaming with [[Dokibird]], [[Laimu (VTuber)|]], and [[Snuffy (VTuber)|]], they are known as the "Sloppy Sisters."

title: rhinedottir_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]]. Also known as "Gold" or "R", she is one of the Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah and a member of the Hexenzirkel. 

Rhinedottir was an alchemist and researcher from Khaenri'ah who attained the pinnacle of knowledge and alchemical prowess. As one of the Five Sinners, she is also a transcendent being who posseses world-shattering Abyssal power. She was a practitioner in the Art of Khemia, a forbidden form of alchemy for creating life, which she used to create many living beings. Among her creations are the [[Rifthound (genshin impact)|Riftwolves]], the dragon [[Durin (real) (genshin impact)|Durin]], the immortal monstrosity [[Bakunawa (genshin impact)|]], the Great Beast [[Elynas (genshin impact)|]] and the artificial human [[Albedo (genshin impact)|]]. Rhinedottir's usage of the Art of Khemia links her as having a major role in causing the Cataclysm. 

Sometime after the Cataclysm, she made a breakthrough in her Primordial Human Project, creating the perfect [[Albedo (genshin impact)|]] and taught him everything she knew. One day, they discovered the Heart of Naberius and Rhinedottir consumed it, causing her to fuse with [[Naberius (genshin impact)|]], one of the Four Shades. At an unknown point in time, she became acquainted with [[Alice (genshin impact)|]] and the other witches, forming the Hexenzirkel.

Voiced by Ivy Dupler in English, [[Yamaguchi Yuriko]] and [[Tanaka Atsuko]] in Japanese and Di Feifei in Chinese.

title: ash_ketchum
body:
Lead character in the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] anime from 1997 to 2023, based on [[Red (pokemon)|]], the player character in the [[pokemon rgby|first Pokémon games]].

Ash is a Pokémon Trainer who, over the course of 1,200+ weekly episodes, took on the challenge of each region that was depicted in the most recent main games at the time, as well as thwarting the evil schemes of the [[Team Rocket]] trio.  He has had a number of travel partners and recurring rivals.

He wears a blue, sleeveless [[vest]] over a [[white shirt]] with a red stripe on the front, as well as [[two-tone shorts]] (blue on the front, dark blue on the back). His new [[baseball cap]] is mostly red, with a white brim and a black [[pokedex|Pokédex]] symbol on the front. He also sometimes carries a green [[backpack]].

His signature Pokémon is [[Pikachu]], which he chooses not to evolve into [[Raichu]] due to it not wanting to.

As a running gag throughout the series, he sometimes [[crossdressing|crossdresses]] under the name [[Ashley (pokemon)|]].

His name in Japanese is a reference to the Pokémon creator, Tajiri Satoshi.

title: sparkle
body:
A momentary bright shimmer of reflected [[light]], generally [[diamond_(shape)|]]-, astroid or [[star (symbol)|]]-shaped, and short-lived. Groups of them tend to appear and vanish in various instances.

[b]Sparkle[/b], [[glint]], and [[diffraction spikes]] all refer to similar patterns of bright lines radiating from a point. They are not clearly differentiated, and usage tends to be context-sensitive. In general:
* [b]Sparkle[/b] is considered the base case. Usually four lines at right angles radiating from a point. Associated with eyes, liquid or particulate matter (e.g. raindrops, snow, sand), or nothing (appearing mid-air). Can appear in large numbers.
* [[Glint]] is associated with solid objects, especially ones which are metallic and/or sharp. Usually appear singly or in small numbers.
* [[Diffraction spikes]] is the technical term for the phenomenon in general, but is used less often. Can be used for more realistic-looking effects or conversely when appearing extremely large and exaggerated. More likely than sparkle and glint to be asymmetric or to have more than four radiating lines.

h4. See also

* [[sparkling aura]] for multiple sparkles around a certain object or character. 
* [[iridescent]]
* [[lens flare]]
* [[bokeh]]
* [[light particles]]

title: razor's_father_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]] who appeared in flashbacks in the version 3.1 event [i]Of Ballads and Brews[/i], he is the father of [[Razor (genshin impact)|]] who's whereabouts are currently unknown.

Him and his [[Razor's Mother (genshin impact)|wife]] were both members of the Adventurer's Guild and decided to name their son "Razor" because it sounded like an adventurer's name. At some point, they both disappeared from Razor's life when he was very young and their son was raised by [[Andrius (genshin impact)|Boreas]] and his [[wolf]] pack in Wolvendom.

Razor's Father has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair|grey]]/[[blue hair]] with [[parted bangs]]. He wears the standard Adventurers' Guild uniform, consisting of a [[white shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] overtop a [[green shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[green vest|green]] [[cross-laced vest]], [[green capelet]], [[red necktie]], a [[brown belt]], [[green pants]], a [[green hat|green]] [[dixie cup hat]] and a pair of [[brown boots]]. 

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Razor's Father":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Razor%27s_Father

title: anna_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]], she has a chronic illness that makes her very sickly and can be cured throughout a series of commissions.

Her older brother, [[Anthony (genshin impact)|]] works hard to pay for her medicine and eventually, with the help of the Traveler, gets her a prescription from a [[Baizhu (genshin impact)|renowned doctor]] in Liyue. After recovering from her illness, Anna has gained a lot of energy and can be found in unusual locations, such as atop a [[windmill]] or in the hands of the [[statue]] of [[Barbatos (genshin impact)|]]. Some time later, she becomes an official member of the Adventurers' Guild.

Anna has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[blue eyes]]. 
Originally, she wore a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], [[brown corset]], a [[brown belt]], [[puffy shorts|puffy]] [[brown shorts|brown]] [[short shorts]], [[white socks]] and a pair of [[brown boots]].
Currently, she wears the standard Adventurers' Guild uniform, consisting of a [[white dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] over [[long sleeves|long]] [[green sleeves]], a [[green skirt]] with [[side slit]]s, a [[short necktie|short]] [[red necktie]], a [[green hat|green]] [[dixie cup hat]], a [[red bow|red]] [[back bow]], [[brown socks]] and a pair of [[brown boots]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Anna":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Anna

title: finger_counting
body:
A hand gesture where a character indicates a number with their fingers raised. Some artists use this for [[countdown]]s, [[anniversary|anniversaries]], and [[milestone celebration|milestone celebrations]].

h4. Common gestures

* Zero: [[ok sign]] (with one hand) or [[circle hands]] (with two hands)
* One: [[index finger raised]] or [[thumbs up]]
* Two: [[v]]
* Three: [[w]] or [[middle w]]
* Four: [[number four (asl)|]] (with one hand) or [[double v]] (with two hands)
* Five: [[open hand]] (with one hand) or [[v]] plus [[w]] (with two hands)
* Eight: [[double number four (asl)|double number four]] or [[open hand]] + [[w]]
* Ten: [[open hands]]

h4.Examples
* !post #4211
* !post #101664
* !post #4209
* !post #4208
* !post #4207

h4. See also

* [[spoken number]] - when a number is spoken, such as in a [[speech bubble]]
* [[number-shaped hands]] - when the hands imitates the actual shape of a number
* Finger counting
** [[Finger counting duo]]
** [[Finger counting trio]]
* [[Tag Group:Gestures]]

title: tracen_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by the characters of [[Umamusume]] as well as their basic outfit.

The [[summer uniform]] consists of a [[purple shirt|purple]] [[sailor shirt|sailor blouse]] with white accents and [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[purple bowtie]] held with a [[horseshoe ornament]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[white skirt]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[purple bow|purple]] [[back bow]], and [[white thighhighs]] or [[over-kneehighs]]; as well as [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]] with medium heels.

The [[winter uniform]] has mostly the same design, but the blouse having [[long sleeves]] with dark purple highlights. Meanwhile, the bowtie is now [[white bowtie|white]], the skirt is [[purple skirt|purple]] instead of white, and the [[purple thighhighs|knee socks are purple]] with a white line decoration.

Additionally, the uniform includes short black [[bike shorts]] worn [[bike_shorts_under_skirt|under the skirt]].

h4. Examples

* !post #3076018: [[Summer uniform]]
* !post #7360132: [[Winter uniform]]

title: kansaiben
body:
A Japanese dialect spoken in the Kansai / Kinki region in Japan.

Kansai dialect is typified by the speech of Osaka, the major city of Kansai, which is referred to specifically as Osaka-ben. It is characterized as being both more melodic and harsher by speakers of the standard language.

This accent is often translated to a southern US accent in English.

h4. Notable characters who speak Kansai dialect

* [[Aizawa Sakuya]] ([[Hayate no Gotoku!]])
* [[Hino Akane (smile precure!)|]] ([[Smile Precure!]])
* [[Ichimaru Gin]] ([[BLEACH]])
* [[Ikeda Chitose]] ([[Yuruyuri]])

* [[Labrys (persona)|]] ([[persona_4:_the_ultimate_in_mayonaka_arena|Persona 4 Arena]])
* [[Lucky Lilac (Umamusume)|]] and [[Tamamo Cross (Umamusume)|]] ([[Umamusume]])
* [[Majima Goro]] ([[Ryuu ga Gotoku (series)|]])

* [[Zen'in Naoya]] ([[Jujutsu Kaisen]])

h4. See also

* [[Kyotoben]], a sub-dialect spoken in [[Kyoto]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Kansai dialect":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kansai_dialect]

title: kyotoben
body: A sub-dialect of [[Kansaiben]] spoken in [[Kyoto]]. h5. Noted speakers * [[Hanayagi Kaoruko]] ([[Shoujo Kageki Revue Starlight]]) * [[Ichimaru Gin]] ([[Bleach]]) * [[Kagenui Yozuru]] ([[Monogatari (series)|]]) * [[Kobayakawa Sae]] ([[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]]) * [[Konoe Konoka]] ([[Mahou Sensei Negima!]]) * [[Lucky Lilac (Umamusume)|]] ([[Umamusume]]) * [[Shiver (Splatoon)|]] ([[Splatoon (series)|]]) * [[Tenkawa Kaoruko]]/[[Magia Sulfur]] ([[Mahou Shoujo ni Akogarete]]) h5. Salient features * Verb conjugations ending in はる haru * The copula どす dosu (standard Japanese です desu) * Unique negative conjugations of the verbs 来る kuru "to come" and する suru "to do": ** Kuru: きいひん kiihin (Osakaben けえへん keehen, standard Japanese こない konai) ** Suru: しいひん shiihin (Osakaben せえへん seehen, standard Japanese しない shinai) * The greetings おこしやす okoshiyasu and おいでやす oideyasu (standard Japanese いらっしゃいませ irasshaimase) h4. External references * https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kansai_dialect#Kyoto * https://japanese.stackexchange.com/questions/367/

title: beheaded_kamikaze
body: A common yet memorable enemy from the [i][[Serious Sam]][/i] series as well as its mascot enemy, a beheaded alien soldier raised from the dead and used in suicide attacks by holding a bomb on each hand. Their iconic scream is thanks to a voice synthesizer located in the device stuck to their neck stumps, which is also used to control them. In-game, they have an extremely simple AI consisting of running at the nearest player and detonating when close enough to the player, they also explode when they die, potentially taking out multiple kamikazes in a chain reaction if they are close enough.

title: cut-here_line
body:
A typically [[dotted line]] with a [[scissors]] symbol (though sometimes other instruments or a direction indicator might be shown), indicating a line along with something should be cut. Often used in [[tattoo]]s to imply [[decapitation]] or [[amputee|amputation]].

Also used in a [[twitter strip game]] variant in which strips of a shirt worn by a character are cut off as the numbers of likes and retweets increase.

h4. See also
* [[meat chart]] - A diagram marking cuts of meat for livestock, sometimes applied to humans in art as a tattoo or [[body writing]]

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Wears a [[black shirt]] and [[black skirt|skirt]] with a [[necktie]].

Sometimes depicted alongside [[Sakuraba Ema]], her former classmate before they were both abducted into a remote island.

[spoilers]Her magic power is "Return by Death".

In the second cycle of the game, she returns to the start of the game before she dies and takes the role of the protagonist.[/spoilers]

title: mahou_shoujo_no_majo_saiban
body:
A [[magical girl]] visual novel with psychological horror and death elements that released on July 18, 2025. The gameplay and story is described as being similar to [[Danganronpa (series)|]].

The game is set in a mansion-like prison on a remote island, where 13 girls with magical powers are kidnapped from society to be isolated due to their possibility of turning into "witches", beings that possess "high murderous intent". While living in the prison, some girls start to turn into "witches" and begin murdering other girls. The surviving girls are then forced to correctly find the "witch" in order to prevent an innocent girl from being executed, or from being executed themselves.

title: ade_(nikke)
body:
A playable character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

She is a member of [[Maid For You (Nikke)|]], consisting of her, [[Cocoa (nikke)|]], [[Soda (nikke)|]], and [[Privaty (Unkind Maid) (Nikke)|Privaty]]. Unlike the other three, Ade is more professional in her duty as a maid.

Like all members of Maid For You, Ade's name is taken from the -ade suffix, usually used in citrus beverages.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied in a [[braid]] with [[green eyes]] and [[large_breasts|large]]/[[huge breasts]]. She wears a [[maid|maid outfit]] consisting of a [[maid headdress|frilled headdress]], [[black shirt]], [[long skirt|long]] [[frilled skirt]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black shoes]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7162895: Default
* !asset #31764203: [[Ade (Maid In Spring) (Nikke)|Maid in Spring]]

title: princess_peach
body:
Lead female character of the [[mario (series)|Mario series]].

Princess of the Mushroom Kingdom, frequent damsel in distress kidnapped by [[Bowser]] and rescued by [[Mario]].

Originally known outside of Japan as "Princess Toadstool", until in 1993 "Peach" appeared in the game [i]Yoshi's Safari[/i], then in 1997 was primarily used in the game [[Mario Kart 64]].

title: princess_daisy
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]]. She is the princess of Sarasaland. Cheerful, energetic, and a bit tomboyish.

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[flipped hair|flipped]] [[brown hair]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[blue eyes]].
For her default costume, she wears a [[pointed crown|pointed]] [[gold crown]], [[flower earrings]], a [[puffy short sleeves|puffy short sleeved]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[yellow dress]] and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[high heels]].

title: anastasia_(idolmaster)
body:
Anastasia is a character for the mobile game [[idolmaster_cinderella_girls|IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]].

She is half Russian, half Japanese. As being half Russian, she usually speaks/mixes some Russian in her sentences. 

Due to her popularity, she was ranked second place in the 2013 Cinderella Girl election and was given a spot on THE IDOLM@STER CINDERELLA MASTER Kagayaku Sekai no Mahou, along with [[Kanzaki Ranko]], [[Takagaki Kaede]], [[Koshimizu Sachiko]], and [[Shibuya Rin]]. Soon after, she was selected for the fifth CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Shirasaka Koume]], [[Ogata Chieri]], [[Sakuma Mayu]], and [[Takamori Aiko]]. Her seiyuu is [[Uesaka Sumire]].

In the anime she is in the unit LOVE LAIKA with [[Nitta Minami]]. Later on, [[Kanzaki Ranko]] temporarily replaces Minami in the unit.

title: raider_(elden_ring)
body:
Raider is a character and playable Nightfarer in [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. He is one of the eight available player classes.
He is a muscular barbarian with tan skin, [[grey hair]] and a beard and a [[huge weapon|huge]] axe, wearing an animal skull and furs.

title: ironeye_(elden_ring)
body:
Ironeye is a character and playable Nightfarer in [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. He is one of the eight available player classes.
Ironeye is an archer with [[green armor]], [[elbow gloves]], [[long sleeves]], a [[hood]], [[cloak]] and [[quiver]]. Under the hood he has [[dark skin]], [[blue eyes]] and [[white hair]].

title: duchess_(elden_ring)
body:
Duchess is a character and playable Nightfarer in [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. She is one of the eight available player classes.

Her default appearance features [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[asymmetrical hair]] with her left sidelock longer than her right, [[parted bangs]] and a [[low ponytail]], not to be confused with [[Lady Maria of the Astral Clocktower]].
She wields a [[dagger]], wears a [[cloak]] or [[capelet]], [[white ascot]], [[white pants]], [[white gloves]], a [[brooch]], and a metal [[blindfold]], also not to be confused with the [[Fire Keeper]].

title: maris_(elden_ring)
body: A Nightlord from [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. Also called by the titles [b]Fathom of Night[/b] or [b]Augur[/b]. Its visual appearance is similar to that of the [[Elden Beast]], though Maris can be distinguished by its fully blue coloration and [[jellyfish]]-like tendrils.

title: caligo_miasma_of_night
body: An ice dragon Nightlord from [[Elden Ring Nightreign]].

title: fulghor_(elden_ring)
body: A giant [[centaur]] Nightlord from [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. Also referred to as "Darkdrift Knight" or "Champion of Nightglow". He has [[amputee|one arm]], wears [[scale armor]] and wields a [[spear]] that he can also use as a [[bow]].

title: gnoster_(elden_ring)

title: gladius_(elden_ring)
body: A monstrous [[cerberus]] and Nightlord from [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. They have [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[orange eyes]], [[breathing fire|breath fire]] and swing a massive [[sword]] around on a chain.

title: libra_(elden_ring)
body: A [[extra eyes|many-eyed]] goat demon and one of the Nightlords from [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. He has several [[yellow eyes]], including on his forehead, neck, and [[very big eyes|massive ones]] in the curves of his [[curled horns]]. He wields a hand-shaped [[mage staff]].

title: stretching
body:
Stretching one's limbs or body, usually to loosen muscles or to alleviate cramps. Often performed before or after [[exercising]], or while [[yawning]] after [[waking up]].

h4. See also

* [[cat stretch]]
* [[cross-body stretch]]
* [[assisted stretching]]

title: recluse_(elden_ring)
body:
Recluse is a character and playable Hero in [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. She is one of the eight available player classes.
Recluse is a [[witch]] with long [[white hair]] worn in [[parted bangs]] or [[curtained hair]], a [[witch hat]], [[black dress]], [[gladiator sandals]], [[wooden staff|wooden]] [[mage staff]], [[white eyelashes]], [[grey eyes]], and [[black skin]].
Her eye color changes to gold and deep purple in her [[official alternate costume]] variations of Dawn and Darkness, respectively.
The hairstyle of her Darkness costume variation is a very large [[long braid]].
The hairstyle of her hatless costume variation is a [[half-updo]], with a [[half up braid]].

title: wylder_(elden_ring)
body:
Wylder is a character and playable Hero in [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. He is one of the eight available player classes.

He is a warrior wielding a [[greatsword]] and wearing a [[winged helmet]], [[blue surcoat]], [[black cloak]], [[plate armor|plate]] and [[scale armor]] and [[brown gloves]]. On his left hand is a mechanical [[arm mounted weapon]]. The surcoat has a border of simple nordic embellishments, but it is also patterned with 3 repeating circular designs of yet unknown provenance also found on the games deluxe edition box art.

title: guardian_(elden_ring)
body:
Guardian is a character and playable Hero in [[Elden Ring Nightreign]]. They are one of the eight available player classes.
Guardian is [[bird boy|pinionfolk]] [[knight]], wielding a [[halberd]] and shield.

title: queen_chrysalis
body:
Major [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]] villain. She is the queen of the Changelings, a race of pony-like creatures with shapeshifting abilities who feed off love. She initially transforms into [[Princess Cadance]] to feed off the love at her wedding.

While the Changelings as a group are eventually reformed thanks to [[Thorax (my little pony)|]], Chrysalis rejects them and plots to regain control of her people.

* [b]English CV[/b]: Kathleen Barr
* [b]Japanese CV[/b]: [[Nazuka Kaori]]

title: hair_over_face
body:
Hair that drapes down over a character's face, obscuring the majority of their face. If the hair only covers one eye or both eyes, it's [[hair over one eye]] or [[hair over eyes]] instead.

Not to be confused with [[hair between eyes]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7369649

h4. See also

* [[long bangs]]
* [[covered face]]
* [[hair over mouth]]
* [[hair over eyes]] - For hair that covers only the character's eyes
* [[eyes visible through hair]] - For when you can see the character's eyes despite the hair in front of them
* [[shaded face]]

title: discord_(my_little_pony)
body:
Major supporting [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]] character, a former villain who redeems himself. He is the embodiment of chaos, and as a result highly unpredictable.

He is close friends with [[Fluttershy]], and in the series finale [spoiler]the two are heavily implied to be a couple after the timeskip, though the writers have said they're leaving the two open to interpretation.[/spoiler]

* [b]English CV[/b]: John de Lancie
* [b]Japanese CV[/b]: [[Chiba Shigeru]]

title: sunset_shimmer
body:
Major [[My Little Pony]] character and reformed antagonist introduced in the [[My Little Pony: Equestria Girls]] series. Originally a [[sunset shimmer (unicorn)|unicorn]] training under [[princess celestia|Princess Celestia]] prior to [[Twilight Sparkle]], who abandoned her studies to cross through the mirror portal to the human world.

Unlike the others, she has no canon human world counterpart that we know of, though the idea was considered. The human form we see in Equestria Girls is simply a transformation of the pony world Sunset.

* [b]English CV[/b]: Rebecca Shoichet
* [b]Japanese CV[/b]: [[Koshimizu Ami]]

title: spike_(my_little_pony)
body:
A young [[dragon]] and a secondary character in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]]. He is [[Twilight Sparkle]]'s assistant and also a direct means of communication with [[Princess celestia|Princess Celestia]]. He can send letters instantly to Celestia by disintegrating them with his flame breath and receives letters from her by belching them out with his flames.

In terms of personality, he tries to act boyish and tough, but usually falls flat in his attempts. He's a bit of a glutton, he views Twilight as being like a surrogate mother to him, and he has a not-very-secret crush on [[Rarity (my little pony)|]].

* [b]English CV[/b]: Cathy Weseluck
* [b]Japanese CV[/b]: Motoko Kumai (seasons 1-2), Koba Rena (seasons 3-6)

[[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]] character, one-third of the [[Cutie Mark Crusaders]]. Lives with her lesbian aunts Lofty and Holiday, as her parents are often busy and away - and idolizes [[Rainbow Dash]], who takes her under her wing. She is a tomboyish daredevil, similar to Dash.

title: nijisanji
body:
[b]Nijisanji[/b] is a face-tracking app and [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] group, managed by Anycolor Inc. (formerly named Ichikara Inc.). The company began activities in early 2018, originally as an app developer with no intention of management (legend saying that at one time management had fewer people than their talent, before Mito exploded in popularity and necessitated more staff). The project was helmed by CEO [[Tazumi Riku]] and then-COO Iwanaga Taiki, the latter having since departed from the company.

While the app has no release date, and early on wasn't even approved by Apple, it is actively used by [i]Nijisanji Project[/i], a group of official [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]s referred to as "Virtual Livers".

Their characters are notably in 2D, instead of the initially more popular and established trend of 3D. This strategy was to minimize upfront investment and allow themselves a broader range of personalities. While some of the more popular characters do also have 3D models, 2D is still used for most appearances.

Many of the characters have alternate variations, such as [[official alternate costume|alternate costume]]s, [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyles]], accessories like [[kemonomimi mode|kemonomimi]], or even [[aged up]] forms. 

The official website offers a short profile for each character; however, the talent is given the freedom to develop their characters as they wish. As a result, few if any actually resemble their original profile. 

h4. Nijisanji Project members 

Initially grouping was done according to the time of debut and the nature of contract, but from 2019 these distinctions were removed and all members placed under [i]Nijisanji Project[/i]. This list represents their origins.

[expand=Nijisanji Gamers]

First debut: May 2, 2018

A group specializing in [[video game]] [[livestream|streaming]], aiming to bridge the gap between the audiences for [[virtual YouTuber]]s and professional gaming. Membership included both professional and casual oriented gamers, however, and activities still involved traditional Liver content such as chatting streams and singing videos. While the group was treated as separate, there were no restrictions from interacting with members outside the group. Integrated into [i]Nijisanji Project[/i] as of 2019.

[expand=Nijisanji SEEDs]

First debut: June 3, 2018

A group based on a "challenge framework with the potential for group activities." Its members were selected for variety, rather than experience or skill. While the group was treated as separate, there were no restrictions from interacting with members outside the group. Integrated into [i]Nijisanji Project[/i] as of 2019.

h4. Nijisanji, China (二次三次, 彩虹社)

Nijisanji's Chinese branch. Most of these members focus their content on Chinese language platforms. 

h5. Nijisanji VTuber Project (二次三次虚拟主播企划) / [[VEgo]]

The original branch, auditions starting on July 17, 2018, and starting from August 24, 2018. It consisted of two parts, one based in Shanghai and the other in Taipei. By the end of March 2019, Nijisanji Shanghai had been deprecated, and on March 29, the branches stopped using the name 'Nijisanji', collectively changing their name to VEgo. VEgo later went inactive on March 31, 2020. Member list found on the branch's Wiki page.

h5. [[VirtuaReal]]

The current Chinese branch, established in collaboration with Bilibili, with auditions starting April 19, 2019, officially starting beginning from May 14, 2019. Member list found on the branch's Wiki page.

h4. Sister projects

* [[Yumenographia]] - service from the same company

* [[AniMare]] and [[Honey Strap]] - sister projects co-founded by (but not controlled by) Anycolor

* Nijisanji NetWORK - a partnership program aimed at supporting virtual talent; lasted from May 10 to December 31, 2019, only members were [[Tenkai Tsukasa]] and [[Fairys (vtuber)|]]

* [[Virtual Talent Academy]] - Anycolor's VTuber Trainee Program, announced on June 18, 2021, and soft-debuted November 1; has so far produced [[Ranunculus (nijisanji)|]], [[VOLTACTION]], [[Idios]], Usami Rito and Saiki Ittetsu (members of Oriens), Koyanagi Rou and Hoshirube Sho (members of Dytica), [[Mitarashi-dan]], Kitami Yusei and Sakaki Ness (members of 3SKM), Shiga Riko, Kisara, and Kozue Mone (members of Ayakaki)

title: lifebuoy
body:
A ring-shaped flotation device designed to be thrown to a person in the water to provide buoyancy and to prevent drowning. It differs from an [[innertube]] because it is often made of solid buoyant material (rather than being air-filled) and is colored to maximize visibility in the water. It also may have a provided line to pull the casualty holding onto it.

The term "life buoy" is most common in British English. In American English these are better known as "life preservers".

h4. Examples

* !post #7670473

h4. See also

* [[swim ring]] 
* [[innertube]]

title: miria_(iriam)
body:
An official image character of [[Iriam]]. Designed by [[Yatomi]].

Her alternate persona is [[Kurumi_(iriam)|]], who works as a live streamer using Miria's image.

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[grey hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[colored inner hair|colored insides]], [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[cat ears]] and [[purple eyes]]. For her regular look, she wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]] with a [[blue jacket]], a [[grey skirt]], [[blue thighhighs]] and [[white shoes|white]] [[sneakers]] with [[mismatched shoelaces]]. 

In her 2025 look, she has [[white hair]] with blue streaks, a [[triangle hair ornament]], a [[hairclip]], multiple [[braid|braids]]. a [[cat ear hairband]], a [[white shrug]] with a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[blue shirt]], a [[white skirt]] [[shorts under skirt|under]] [[black shorts]], a blue [[thigh strap]], [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]] and [[white boots]].

h4. Appearances

* !post #5709917: Original appearance
* !post #9932763: 2025 appearance

title: lappland_(arknights)
body:
[i]Operator Lappland can't wait to slash apart the enemies in front of her.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoiler]Lappland Saluzzo[/spoiler]

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[imai asami|Asami Imai]] (Japanese), Chen Yanti (Chinese), Christina Kowalchuck (English), Seo Yu-ri (Korean), and Elisa Contestabile (Italian). Her art designer is [[huanxiang heitu]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Siracusa[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]November 11[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Lupo[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]162 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A deranged special ops Operator for Rhodes Island, with impressive destructive prowess in tactical assaults and search-and-destroy missions. Her choice of weapon is dual swords.

Often depicted together with [[Texas (Arknights)|]] due to their past relationship. [spoiler]She is the heir of the mafia family Saluzzo. She and Texas grew up together in Siracusa, where they engaged in typical [i]mafioso[/i] activities, until the latter cut ties with all of it. Lappland's obsession originates from this event, as she could not understand how a girl so similar to her managed to leave the mafia behind while she could not. She wants to prove to Texas, and to herself, that Siracusa can never be left behind.[/spoiler]

Her motif is based on the extinct Newfoundland wolf. Her callsign is named after the northernmost area in Sweden and Finland.

title: lovebrush_chronicles
body:
[i]Lovebrush Chronicles[/i], known as [i]For All Time[/i] in its native Chinese, is a mobile otome game by PC and mobile game company NetEase Interactive Entertainment. It received an English localization on October 20th, 2023 for Android and iOS devices. 

The player plays as an art major freshman at St. Shelter Academia and the author behind the popular manga "In Passing", who soon finds out that she has the ability to travel to different dimensions and summon her own arts for combat after being sent to Godheim - the world featured in her manga. In these parallel universes, their inhabitants are incarnations of the people from your world. From then on, you embarks on an endless voyage across time and space to learn the truth and protect what you hold dear alongside or against familiar faces. 

The game combines story-driven visual novel with adventure and RPG elements. Outside of the main storyline, the player can spend time with the love interests with various activities or working to increase your reputation in school.  

h4. Main characters
* [[Heroine (lovebrush chronicles)|]] 
* [[Ayn Alwyn]]
* [[Lars Rorschach]] 
* [[Alkaid McGrath]] 
* [[Clarence Clayden]]  
* [[Cael Anselm]]

title: innertube
body:
A flotation device used as a recreational swimming aid, especially by young children and older persons who cannot swim. So called because it resembles (and in earlier times, usually [i]was[/i]) the inner tube of a car tire.

They are often constructed of transparent material, ostensibly for better visibility of the wearer.

A [[lifebuoy]] is visually similar, but its use and usual material composition are different.

h4. Examples

* !post #6614036

h4. See also

* [[inflatable armbands]]
* [[inflatable toy]]
* [[donut innertube]]
* [[duck innertube]]
* [[watermelon innertube]]
* [[innertube with ears]]
* [[holding swim ring]]

title: swim_ring
body:
A ring-shaped device used as a flotation aid. Two types may be distinguished, based on their form, intended role and context in which they appear:

* [[Innertube]] - Air-filled and intended for recreational use. May be varicolored, or semi-transparent.
* [[Lifebuoy]] - Made of a durable foam and intended for life-saving in emergency situations. Usually colored red, white, or in alternating red and white bands.

h4. Examples

* !post #6614036: [[Innertube]]
* !post #7670473: [[Lifebuoy]]

title: revolver
body:
A [[gun]] that has a single barrel and a rotating cylinder that contains multiple [[ammunition|rounds]] (usually five or six). The cylinder revolves as the [[weapon]] [[firing|fires]].

Revolvers should normally be tagged with [[handgun]], as most typically are. However there are rare examples of revolver [[rifle]]s, [[shotgun]]s, and even [[grenade launcher]]s like the [[Milkor MGL]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[red eyes|red]]/[[purple eyes]], and wears a [[white headwear]] and [[black dress]].

A gentle, generous, and very worldly Doll who pushes herself to always do her utmost best and never allows herself to give up halfway through... A habit that has become the cause of her OCD. Today, she's feeling troubled because she's unsure whether her desk is centralized in her room.

body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Mint Castella]].

It's a [[gyaru]] outfit consisting of a [[pink jacket|pink]] [[fur trim]]med [[cropped jacket]] over a [[tied shirt|tied]] [[white shirt]] and a [[green bra]], blue [[denim shorts]], [[pink boots]], and a [[pink collar]] and [[pink leash|leash]] on her neck.

Her hair [[official alternate hair color|in this costume]] (along with her tail) is [[blonde hair|blonde]] with brown [[roots (hair)|]] and is [[official alternate hairstyle|worn in]] [[twintails]], and her [[official alternate eye color|eyes]] are now [[pink eyes|pink]].

title: shokuhou_misaki
body:
A [[ToAru Majutsu no Index]] character. First mentioned in [i]Index[/i], but officially introduced in the [[ToAru Kagaku no Railgun]] manga, and main character of the [[ToAru Kagaku no Mental Out]] manga, Misaki is Academy City's 5th ranked [[Level 5 (ToAru)|]]. 

Nicknamed Mental Out (心理掌握 [i]Shinri Shouaku[/i], lit. Psychological Control) after her ability, which allows for a wide range of effects, including telepathy and mind control. Also nicknamed The Queen of Tokiwadai, she is the second Level 5 enrolled in Tokiwadai Middle School, along with [[Misaka Mikoto]]. They're often at odds with each other.

She has [[very long hair|very]] [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[yellow eyes|yellow]]/[[brown eyes]] with [[star-shaped pupils]], and [[large breasts]]. She is 168-169 cm tall.

She wears the standard [[Tokiwadai school uniform]] with [[white gloves|white]] [[spider web print]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]] with the same print. She typically carries around a [[handbag]] with [[remote control]]s.

In [[Blue Archive]] she has a [[pink halo|pink]] [[star halo]] similar to her star-shaped pupils. She carries a [[Staccato 2011]] pistol as an additional firearm.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8647595
* !post #7504629: [[Blue Archive]]

h4. External links

* "Toaru Majutsu no Index Wiki: Shokuhou Misaki":http://toarumajutsunoindex.wikia.com/wiki/Shokuhou_Misaki
other_names: 食蜂操祈(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: no_one_lives_forever
body:
The Operative: No One Lives Forever is a FPS video game developed by Monolith Productions and published by Fox Interactive, released for Windows in 2000 (and later on Mac & PS2). Its sequel "No One Lives Forever 2: A Spy in H.A.R.M.'s Way" was released in 2002. A spin-off, ''Contract J.A.C.K.'', was released in 2003.

Set during the 1960s, the main protagonist is [[Cate Archer]], a former cat burglar and new operative for UNITY, a British international spy organization as she battles the evil criminal organization H.A.R.M. throughout the world.

Despite good reviews and sales, the game is not available to buy digitally or have a remastered version today as a results of ongoing legal disputes over who owns the rights for the games between [[Disney]], [[Activision]] and [[Warner Bros.]] after all three bought the publishers and developers of the games separately.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - The Operative: No One Lives Forever":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Operative:_No_One_Lives_Forever]
* "Wikipedia - No One Lives Forever 2: A Spy in H.A.R.M.s way":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_One_Lives_Forever_2:_A_Spy_in_H.A.R.M.%27s_Way]

title: idolmaster_million_live!
body:
An extension of the [[Idolmaster|iDOLM@STER]] franchise designed for mobile devices. The original used the GREE social gaming platform, in which players would raise and battle their idols against other players.

In addition to the original [i]iDOLM@STER[/i] girls, the game adds many more new characters, all designed by A-1 Pictures, which produced the [i]iDOLM@STER [/i] anime.  These characters are then divided into three categories, Dance, Visual, and Vocal.

In [i]Million Live![/i], these idols are collectively known as the 765 Million Stars, and are presented as effectively being part of 765 Production.  Additionally, unlike [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]], all starting [i]Million Live![/i] idols already have seiyuu and a CD.

It received a communication and rhythm game based spinoff, [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days]], that also introduced two more idols and an assistant.

Bandai Namco Entertainment announced, beginning in December 2017, the original game would be systematically shut down, and service ended March 19 the next year. 
[I]Theater Days[/i]  continues to receive updates and support as the main game.

h4. Characters

(*) = from [i]iDOLM@STER [/i]


All idols were categorized into the Dance (Blue Diamond), Visual (Yellow Star), and Vocal (Pink Heart) attributes.
In [i]Theater Days[/i], they are categorized into Princess (Pink Crown), Fairy (Blue Snowflake), and Angel (Yellow Wing) attributes.

title: y2k_fashion
body:
A [[fashion]] style based on the style trends of the late '90s and early 2000s, the cusp of the new millennium - as well as 2000s retrofuturism. The modern Y2K fashion revival has been spearheaded by musical acts such as [[PinkPantheress]] and certain [[k-pop]] girl groups - most notably [[NewJeans]].

Clothing often uses shiny materials, [[fur]], and [[denim]], and may be decorated with sequins or [[rhinestone]]s. [[Leopard print]] and [[camouflage]] are common, as well as imagery of butterflies, stars, and hearts.

Common garments include [[tube top]]s and cropped [[tank top]]s and big [[jacket]]s on the upper body, and oversized pants such as [[cargo pants]] or [[bell-bottoms]], denim shorts and skirts, or [[miniskirt]]s in bright colors on the lower body. Bottomwear often has a low-rise waistline. Common accessories include [[sunglasses]], [[belt]]s with heart-shaped or jeweled buckles, [[leg warmers|leg]] and [[arm warmers]], fluffy [[hat]]s, and [[handbag]]s. Footwear commonly worn includes [[fur-trimmed boots]], and [[platform footwear]].

It may sometimes overlap with [[cyber fashion]], [[gyaru]], [[streetwear]] and [[heisei retro]]. Additionally, it can overlap with [[1990s fashion]]. The "trashy Y2K" subcategory is [[McBling]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7928623
* !post #8232179

h4. See also

* [[2000s (style)]]
* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]

title: cyber_fashion
body:
A Japanese fashion style that emerged in the 1990s in Harajuku. It shares similarities with [[Y2K fashion]] in that it is focused on 90s and 2000s retrofuturism.

The style primarily resolves around artificial-looking materials such as glossy vinyl, faux fur, and anything shiny. Clothing and accessories are often [[see-through clothes|see-through]], [[glowing]] or holographic. Common accessories include [[visor cap]]s, [[headphones]], [[goggles]], [[mask]]s, plastic jewelry, etc. Clothing is often brightly colored, and common motifs include aliens, stars, planets, computers, etc. [[UFO skirt]]s are commonly associated with the style.

Similar to [[cybergoth]] fashion in the West, [[cyberlox|synthetic dreadlocks]] are also sometimes worn in bright colors.

h4. Examples

* !post #921269
* !post #2407752
* !post #6746133
* !post #7115832

* [[Raver]]
* [[Tag group:Fashion style]]

* "Aesthetics Wiki: Cyberpop":[https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Cyberpop]

title: wisteria
body:
A woody [[vines|vine]] whose [[flower|flowers]] hang down in pendulous, elongated clusters. The blossoms are colored either white, violet, pink, or purple.

Not to be confused with [[willow]], a type of tree with hanging, long and slender branches that sprout leaves along their lengths. Nor should it be confused with [[lilac]], a shrub that has fragrant violet, pink or white flowers.

h4. Other Fabaceae species

* [[Clover (flower)|Clover flower]]
* [[Jade vine]]
* [[Lupinus (flower)|]]
* [[Mimosa (flower)|]]
* [[Sweet pea]]

title: eve_(gundam_build_divers_re:rise)
body:
A side character from [i][[gundam_build_divers_re:rise|Gundam Build Divers Re:Rise]][/i].

Eve is a mysterious girl whom [[kuga_hiroto|Hiroto]] met within the virtual world of the "Gundam Battle Nexus" (GBN) online game, and eventually developed feelings for before an unspecified event leading to her death. [spoilers]As it turns out, Eve is actually an "El-Diver", digitalized remnants of a distant alien civilization reborn from GBN's accumulative excess data, and her absorbing the excess power from [[sara_(gundam_build_divers)|her fellow El-Diver]] ultimately deteriorates her body, forcing a distraught Hiroto to euthanize her.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]Fortunately, being an El-Diver born from GBN's servers, Eve was eventually reborn into an entirely new El-Diver named [[may_(gundam_build_divers_re:rise)|May]], who went to reunite with Hiroto as a member of "BUiLD DIVERS".[spoilers]

Alternate terms, depending on age range, can include cougar, hag, or MILF ([b]M[/b]other [b]I[/b]'d [b]L[/b]ike to [b]F[/b]uck; used regardless of the fact whether she's had children or not).

A woman that is said to be a mother or shown with her own children does not automatically make her a mature female. She must [i]look[/i] like an older woman to count.

title: lina_inverse
body:
The notoriously hot-tempered, bandit-killing, fireball-throwing "Dragon Spooker" who appears in every incarnation of the [[Slayers]] franchise. Lina is a traveling sorceress who has mastered black magic and is known for utilizing the highly destructive spell Dragon Slave at inappropriate times. Despite her foul temper and extreme power, Lina also possesses a cool mind which helps her get out of nearly impossible situations.

The [[lina (dota)|Lina Inverse]] seen in [[dota 2|Defense of the Ancients 2]] is a direct [[name connection]] and likeness to this character.
Voiced by [[Hayashibara Megumi]]

title: ookami_mio
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]] [[hololive Gamers|Gamers]]. Designed by [[Izumi Sai]] and rigged by [[Rariemonn]].

She is a [[wolf girl]] with a primarily black-red color scheme, mixing Japanese and western elements in her costume. She has [[wolf ears]], a [[black tail|black]] [[wolf tail]] (which she usually keeps [[tail wrap|wrapped]] [[tail around own leg|around her left thigh]] so people don't touch it), [[yellow eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] multicolored [[flipped hair|flipped]] [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[black hair]] with [[white hair|white]] tips and [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]]. Her default hairstyle is [[low-tied long hair]] with [[double-parted bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[hairclip]] styled after an eye glint.

title: v.iv_rusty
body:
A NPC in the game [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]]. An augmented human and AC pilot associated with the Arquebus Corporation, fourth squad leader of the Vespers, assigned the title V. IV (pronounced 'Vee Four' or 'Vesper Four'). Pilots the AC [[Steel Haze]]/[[Steel Haze Ortus]].

As an [[Armored Core]] character, there is no in-game characterization of Rusty, so all fan art of him is up to individual artist's imagination, and sometimes Rusty is [[mechanization|mechanized]] using Steel Haze/Ortus parts.

title: how_do_you_do_fellow_kids_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] that originated from the American tv show [[30 Rock]]. The gag comes from Jack Donaghy's (Alec Baldwin) private investigator, Lenny Wosniak (Steve Buscemi), who claims to have worked in an undercover police task force of youthful looking cops that infiltrate high schools, a reference to the popular cop show, [b]21 Jump Street[/b], which featured a young [[Johnny Depp]]. However, when the audience sees a flashback of Wosniak undercover at a high school, he tries to blend in by saying "[i]How do you fellow kids[/i]?" to a group of high schoolers, who aren't fooled since Wosniak is too old to look like a teenager.

The meme has since been used to joke about older people that tryand fail to sound hip with modern youths.

title: w_(arknights)

[i]W, Sarkaz mercenary, is the single most dangerous signal on the battlefield.[/i]

A Reunion Movement squad leader who had previously cut her teeth as a Sarkaz mercenary in [[Arknights]], and a playable Sniper Operator later on.

Originally designed by [[Lowlight Kirilenko]] as a scrapped [[w (girls' frontline)|member]] of the AR Team in [[Girls' Frontline]], she was retooled and brought into Arknights as the explosives-wielding member of Reunion, still wielding her [[M4 Carbine|Mk18 Mod0]] throughout it all, alongside her [[grenade launcher]] and [[detonator]]. She was then picked up by [[Liduke]] upon her playable debut, who has been doing her art since.

title: ambience_synesthesia
body:
[b]Ambience Synesthesia[/b] is an annual real-world live concert featuring music from [[Arknights]], hosted by Hypergryph in China. The first concert was held in May 2021, the second took place in October 2022,  the third between April-May 2023 and the fourth in May 2024.

As part of the concert's promotion, some of the Arknights characters were drawn with new costumes.

The Ambience Synesthesia tag is to be used when an Arknights character is wearing costumes from the concert.

title: reccoa_londe
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] universe.

She first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] series from 1985. 

[b]Reccoa Londe[/b] is an [[orange hair]]ed member of the [[AEUG]] intelligence division and a [[mobile_suit|MS]] [[pilot]]. Her [[mecha]] of choice is the [[Methuss]]. 

[spoiler]A former teen rebel guerrilla fighter who fought Zeon forces during their occupation of Earth at the early stages of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. She was captured during a mission and abused by several male Zeon soldiers, what left a mark in her psyche and made her suicidal and often willing to take very risky missions, as well as to develop relationships with psychologically abusive and controlling men.

Years later she joined the AEUG at the start of The Gryps War. During this time Reccoa was involved in a relationship with [[Quattro Bajeena]]. She also became friends with [[Kai Shiden]] during a mission infiltrating the Titans' base at Jaburo on planet Earth. Later during another infiltration mission on the Titans ship [i]The Jupitris[/i], Reccoa met [[Paptimus Scirocco]], who used his Newtype powers and charm to discover her disguise and affiliation and eventually turn her to the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] side. Reccoa was given the [[Palace Athene]] MS by Scirocco and she killed [[Bask Om]] after destroying his ship with it (on Paptimus orders).[/spoiler] 

[spoiler]Reccoa Londe later died fighting against [[Emma Sheen]]'s [[Gundam Mk II]] at the final space battle of The Gryps War.[/spoiler]

title: roberto_(gundam)
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]Roberto[/b] is a veteran [[AEUG]] mobile suit pilot with a [[mustache]] and one of [[Quattro Bajeena]]'s loyal wingmen. His [[mobile_Suit|MS]] of choice is the [[Rick Dias]], initially painted black and grey, then red.

[spoilers]Roberto used to be a [[Zeon]] MS pilot (Real name: Ricardo Vega) during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. He dies while protecting an AEUG [[space shuttle]], killed when his Rick Dias was destroyed by a [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[Asshimar]] piloted by [[Buran Blutarch]] during the [i]Battle of Kennedy Spaceport[/i].[/spoilers]

title: autism
body:
[b]Autism Spectrum Disorder[/b] (ASD) is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by increased difficulty with social interaction and communication. Other common symptoms include pervasive interests, repetitive movements (stimming), and rigid routines.

Use this tag for posts where autism is a theme or explicitly mentioned by a character.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autism]
* "World Health Organization":[https://www.who.int/news-room/fact-sheets/detail/autism-spectrum-disorders]
