title: susie_lavoie
body:
A [[Dead by Daylight]] character and a member of [[the legion (dead by daylight)|"The Legion"]]. She is a shy and naive girl who is implied to be the youngest member of her group. In the Killer's lore, she is noted to have been particularly unwilling to kill a person, reacting with disbelief at her friends' willingness to do so before she was also forced to participate by [[Frank Morrison]]. She is best friends with [[Julie Kostenko]], whom she has feelings for, and [[Joey Cadogan]].

Her base cosmetic does not come with the DLC and must be purchased from the in-game store. It features an [[oversized clothes|oversized]] [[aqua hoodie]] with [[thumb hole sleeves]], a [[torn skirt|torn]] [[pink skirt|pink]] or [[red skirt|red]] [[plaid skirt]] with [[black leggings]] underneath, [[green shoes|green]] or [[aqua shoes|aqua]] [[high_tops|high top]] [[converse]] [[sneakers]], a [[black collar|black]] [[belt collar]], a dirty [[white mask]] that has been stitched together, and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] poking out from under her hood. Her weapon of choice is a wooden [[ruler]] that has been sharpened into a stake with sharp objects [[tape|taped]] to it and her name written on it, stylized as "SUZIE".

title: frank_morrison
body:
A [[Dead by Daylight]] character and the leader of [[the legion (dead by daylight)|"The Legion"]]. He is a 19 year old high school dropout, the eldest member of the group, and is responsible for corrupting the other members into becoming criminals, and then later, killers. He is canonically in a relationship with another member of his group, [[Julie Kostenko]].

His base cosmetic features a [[white_mask|white]] smiling [[mask]] with [[blood on mask|blood smeared upwards over the eye holes and across the side of the mouth]], a [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[leather jacket]], an [[ammunition belt]], [[blue pants|blue]] or [[grey pants|grey]] [[skinny jeans]], [[bandaged hand]]s, and [[black shoes|black]] [[sneakers]]. He notably has a [[skull tattoo|skull]] [[neck tattoo]] though some artists may choose to omit this.

title: julie_kostenko
body:
A [[Dead by Daylight]] character and a member of [[the legion (dead by daylight)|"The Legion"]]. She is best friends with [[Susie Lavoie]] and canonically in a relationship with the leader of her group, [[Frank Morrison]].

Her base cosmetic features a [[white_mask|white]] smiling [[mask]] with [[blood on mask|blood smeared down across the forehead and across the side of the mouth]], a [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[leather jacket]], an [[ammunition belt]], [[brown pants|brown]] [[skinny jeans]], [[bandaged hand]]s, and [[black shoes|black]] [[sneakers]]. Given that their outfits are nearly identical, many artists choose to distinguish her from Frank by drawing her with the mask from her "Suspended" cosmetic, which is a [[white mask]] with an [[x mouth]], instead of the smiling mask the pair share.

title: the_legion_(dead_by_daylight)
body:
[[Frank Morrison]], [[Julie Kostenko]], [[Susie Lavoie]], and [[Joey Cadogan]] or "The Legion" are a close-knit group of masked killers and one of the playable Killers featured in the asymmetrical horror game [[Dead by Daylight]].  They are the only Killer to date to be made up of multiple members, two that come with the DLC (Frank and Julie), and two that you can obtain via cosmetics (Susie and Joey).

Due to the nature of this Killer being a group, this tag should only be used if one of the killer masks they wear in their cosmetics is present regardless of if it is being worn. A member's name can also be tagged if you can determine who is being pictured. Artworks not featuring their killer masks should only be tagged as their names.

title: yamamura_sadako
body:
The iconic antagonist of the Japanese horror movie [[The Ring]]. A [[ghost]] girl who haunts a cursed video tape by emerging [[through screen|through the screen]] of anyone who watches it.

Due to her corpse having spent too long at the bottom of a well, she has [[pale skin]], [[long hair|long]], [[black hair|black stringy hair]] [[hair over eyes|covering both of her eyes]], and her fingernails rotted away. She wears a [[white robe]], which is sometimes depicted as a [[white dress]] instead.

She has enjoyed long-lasting popularity in the Japanese - and later worldwide - anime community due to a trend of "moe-ifying" into a ghost girl with [[large breasts]] who will become shy when her eyes are exposed or when her would-be victim pointed out her breasts. This characterization has later become the archetypical depiction of various "ghost girls" in various anime media.

h4. See also

* [[Samara Morgan]] - her western counterpart
* [[Brazilian Sadako]]
* [[Hasshaku-sama]]

h4. External links

* "The Ring Wiki: Sadako Yamamura":http://ring.wikia.com/wiki/Sadako_Yamamura
* "Wikipedia: Sadako Yamamura":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sadako_Yamamura

title: asakawa_yoichi
body:
A character from [[The Ring]], protagonist [[Asakawa Reiko]]'s young son.

While he is a child in the original film, an adult version of him appears in [[Dead By Daylight]] as a playable survivor added for the game's collaboration with The Ring.

title: ant_tenna
body:
The primary antagonist of [[Deltarune]]'s third chapter, acting as the host of "TV Time" [spoilers]and holding [[Toriel]] captive at the behest of the [[Roaring Knight]][/spoilers].
He appears as a [[humanoid]] Darkner with a [[CRT]] for a [[object head|head]] and a [[long nose|long]] [[pointy nose]], wearing a red [[tailcoat]] and [[black pants]]. [[mixed media|Unlike other characters]] his sprites are rendered from a [[3D]] model.

title: king_halo_(king_of_emeralds)_(umamusume)
body:
The racing outfit of [[Umamusume]]'s [[King Halo (Umamusume)|]]. 

It consists of a [[double-breasted]] [[green dress]] worn [[layered dress|over]] a [[white dress]], [[black gloves]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[white shoes]].

title: rain_(zenless_zone_zero)
body:
A reoccurring NPC in [[Zenless Zone Zero]]. A hacker by trade, she regularly collaborates and assists the Phaethon siblings with their commissions.  

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium]] [[pink hair]] with a [[blunt bangs]] and a [[cloud hair ornament]]. She normally wears a [[white shirt|]] [[collared shirt]] underneath a [[black hoodie]] with a [[loose necktie]], light blue [[jeans]], and [[sneakers]]. Other parts of her outfit include a [[grey choker]], [[earbuds]], and a [[backpack]].

title: ray_yersin
body: An NPC in [[Zenless Zone Zero]]. She is a member of the White Star Institute who directs research activities in Hollow Zero and can be found at Scott Outpost.

title: officer_mewmew
body: An NPC in [[Zenless Zone Zero]]. They are the mascot for New Eridu Public Security.

title: orchidea_(zenless_zone_zero)
body: An NPC in [[Zenless Zone Zero]]. She is the manager of Dew Gardening shop in Lumina Square.

title: kizuna_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]"Bond, Relationship, Ties". This name was given to him after his owner was given warm words from people around him when he was visiting Dubai for the 2011 Dubai World Cup (he was there for [[Transcend (racehorse)|]]), which happened two weeks after the [[2011 tohoku earthquake and tsunami|2011 Tohoku Earthquake]]. It coincided with Kizuna turning 1 year old.[/tn]

[table]
[body]
[tr]
[td]Sire:[/td]
[td][[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Grandsire:[/td]
[td][[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Dam:[/td]
[td][[Catequil (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[Storm Cat (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Catequil (racehorse)|]]. He is a brown horse with a triangle-shaped star marking and socks on all legs but the front left leg.

As the winner of the 2013 Japanese Derby, he is famed for his rivalry with [[Epiphaneia (racehorse)|]]. He also jointly holds the record for being the winner of the Japanese Derby with the oldest mother at birth (Catequil was then 20 years old, Kizuna shares this record with [[Minami Homare (racehorse)|]], winner in 1942).

He is also a very popular sire due to his versatility and consistency, although relatively few are G1 winners, his leading progeny currently being the G1-bereft [[Deep Bond (racehorse)|]], the [[Nice Nature (racehorse)|]] of the Reiwa era. His actual best progeny is [[Songline (racehorse)|]] (2022-2023 Yasuda Kinen, 2023 Victoria Mile), while his other G1 winners include [[Justin Milano (racehorse)|]] (2024 Satsuki Sho) and [[Akai Ito (racehorse)|]] (2021 Queen Elizabeth II Cup).

title: ai-generated
body:
An image or video that, rather than being fully drawn or animated by a human artist, was fully generated by an artificial intelligence model.

This tag applies to [b]fully AI-generated images[/b] or [b]fully AI-generated animation[/b]. That is, images or videos that underwent no edits or extremely minor retouches. For edited images and videos, see [[AI-assisted]].

[b]Fully AI-generated art is against the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]][/b] and should not be uploaded. [[AI-assisted]] artwork is allowed as long as it meets quality standards and it was made with sufficient human involvement.

h4. Examples

* !post #7404815: [[Stable Diffusion]] (2022)
* !post #6387617: [[Stable Diffusion]] (2022)
* !post #5851580: [[nai_diffusion|NovelAIv1]] (2022)
* !post #7402576: [[Midjourney]] (2023)
* !post #7173141: [[Midjourney|nijijourney]] (2023)
* !post #7634318: [[dall-e|DALL·E 3]] (2023)
* !post #7096638: [[nai_diffusion|NovelAIv3]] (2023)
* !post #8865710: [[Stable Diffusion|NoobAI-XL]] (2024)
* !asset #24887514: [[nai_diffusion|NovelAIv4]] (2025)
* !asset #25339296: [[GPT4o|GPT4o]] (2025)
* !post #8945894: [[PixVerse]] (2025)

h4. Identification

Below are some common signs that something may be AI-generated. If you are unsure whether a post is AI-generated or not, ask in topic #22285.

h6. Generic art style

Many models have a distinctive "samey" art style. You can browse {{ai-generated status:deleted}} to get a feel for this.

Note that having a generic-looking art style isn't necessarily evidence of AI. Some artists may naturally draw this way, or have had their style copied by AI.

h6. AI resolutions

Certain image resolutions are commonly used by AI models, and less often used by humans. These include:

* {{width:832 height:1216|832×1216}}, {{width:1024 height:1024|1024×1024}}, {{width:1216 height:832|1216×832}} (used by Stable Diffusion XL and NovelAI's Opus-tier).
* {{width:512 height:768|512×768}}, {{width:768 height:1152|768×1152}}, {{width:768 height:512|768×512}}, {{width:1152 height:768|1152×768}}, {{width:768 height:1152|768x1152}}, {{width:1248 height:1824|1248×1824}}, {{width:1824 height:1248|1824×1248}}, {{width:1536 height:1536|1536×1536}}.

In general, AI models cannot generate at a resolution where both height and width are not divisible by 8, although humans can upscale, crop, or edit the final output to make it any resolution.

h6. EXIF metadata

If the file contains metadata such as AI prompts or model names, it's a sure sign it's AI. On the upload page, you can click the filesize beneath the image to see the EXIF metadata. Danbooru will automatically show a warning and tag [[AI-generated]] after upload if the metadata indicates it is AI-generated.

Note that it's possible for an artist to draw on top of an AI-generated base or use an [[AI-generated background]], in which case the work may be considered [[AI-assisted]] instead of fully [[AI-generated]].

h6. Inhuman mistakes

AI models often make abnormal or unusual mistakes within the artwork, such as:

* [[Anatomical nonsense]], such as extra legs (post #5732513), fused fingers (post #5742855), fused legs (post #5735212), etc.
* Strangely drawn objects/environments such as a book with it's cover as another layer of pages (post #5738243), wooden floor conforming with the shape of a character's hair (post #5850417), poor line continuity/object permanence when an object is hidden or goes behind other objects (post #5779922), etc.

Note that [[bad hands]] or other [[artistic error]]s are not in themselves signs of AI-generation, as humans can make mistakes too. The errors made by AI tend to be completely illogical or physically impossible things that no human would draw.

h6. Large volumes of art

A brand new artist pumping out improbably large volumes of high quality-looking art in a short period of time, faster than any human could produce, is a strong indicator of AI. This isn't automatically a sign of AI-generation though, as sometimes new artists may release a pre-prepared portfolio of artwork to establish their presence on a new platform.

h6. Unnatural art style changes

An artist with an unnatural change in art style after early-October 2022 (when NovelAI released their first image generation model) may be a sign they switched to using AI. This can easily be seen with artists with a low quality art style suddenly shifting into the generic-looking art style typical of NovelAI.

Some other notable dates for this would be:

* 2023/11/15 - NovelAI V3 release
* 2024/10/18 - NoobAI-XL release
* 2025/02/28 - NovelAI V4 release
* 2025/03/26 - GPT4o native image generation release
* 2025/05/29 - NovelAI V4.5 release

Bear in mind that humans can naturally change their style or improve over time too. This would be for unnatural changes in style.

h6. Garbled text

Older models have trouble generating realistic text, often producing gibberish or nonsense instead. Newer models may be better at generating text.

A lack of any signatures, web addresses, or watermarks can also be a clue, as human artists often sign their work, while fully AI-generated works often lack signatures.

h6. AI mentions

Mentions of using "AI", software such as "ComfyUI", or common models such as "Nijijourney," "Midjourney," "NovelAI," or "Stable Diffusion" in the tags, description, or the artist's bio are a very likely sign of AI. Be careful not to confuse prohibitions against AI training with admissions of AI use.

h4. AI models

These are some of the most common models seen on Danbooru:

* [[DALL-E]]
* [[Midjourney]] (Nijijourney, etc.)
* [[Stable Diffusion]]
** "Pony Diffusion":[https://civitai.com/models/257749]
** "Illustrious":[https://civitai.com/models/795765]
*** "NoobAI-XL":[https://civitai.com/models/833294]
* [[nai diffusion|NovelAI Diffusion]]

h4. See also

* [[AI-Generated art (topic)]]
* [[AI-Generated background]]
* [[AI Angry Dr. Mario (Meme)]]
* [[AI Drawing Anime Characters Eating Ramen (Meme)]]
* [[AI Drawing Person in Cake (Meme)]]
* [[Gaming Penis Ikebana (Meme)]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Artificial intelligence art":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence_art]
* "Wikipedia: AI slop":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AI_slop]
* "NovelAI":[https://novelai.net/]
* "Civitai":[https://civitai.com/]
* "AIBooru":[https://aibooru.online/]

title: kuonji_alice
body:
One of the main characters of [[Mahou Tsukai no Yoru]]. She is the owner of the Kuonji estate and [[Aozaki Aoko]]'s roommate. She has a British mother and a Japanese father, with her inheriting magic from her mother as a Meinster witch.

She was implemented as a Caster-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Kumano Onsen Satsujin Jiken]] event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Koyama Hirokazu]]

title: adnachiel_(arknights)
body:
[i]Adnachiel, Sniper Operator of Rhodes Island, will interrupt the enemies' attacks with his crossbow.[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Laterano[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]May 30[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sankta[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]171 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]½ year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A clever young Laterano citizen, before he joined Rhodes Island, he used to worked as a freelancer, now assigned as a Sniper Operator of Reserve Op Team A4.

Uses a personally-modified crossbow as his preferred weapon because he doesn't have a permit to use a gun.

His [[voice actor]] is [[Kawanishi Kengo]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5679161: Default
* !post #5830871: [[adnachiel (traceless walker) (arknights)|Traceless Walker]]

title: yamada_(sakusei_byoutou)
body:
The protagonist of [[Sakusei Byoutou]].

The Original CG and the VN depict him as faceless, but in the manga (both 18+ and all ages) and the OVA, he has a face.

A student with dwarfism and a strange disease that forces him to masturbate to remove semen from his body every 3 hours or else it will explode.

[spoiler]His special sperm(which is infertile) is a very valuable ingredients in the drugs that [[Amamiya (Sakusei Byoutou)|Dr. Amamiya]] produces. The disease is also why Yamada is very short, as past a certain point, his body produces sperm instead of the muscle needed to grow. 
 [/spoiler]

title: rurouni_kenshin
body: A Historical Samurai manga series by [[Watsuki Nobuhiro]] that ran in [[Shounen Jump]] from 1994 until 1999. It was adapted into a 95 episode anime series that ran from 1996 to 1998 and several anime films. Five live action movies based on the series have been released. A reboot of the anime began airing on December 2023.
other_names: るろうに剣心-明治剣客浪漫譚-

title: muscular_female
body:
A female character with visibly developed [[muscular|muscles]] that must have come from extensive training, body building or otherwise. 

[[Muscular female]]s usually have overall enlarged musculature, leaving the character looking thicker and more masculine without removing all traces of femininity. It's not just well developed [[abs]]. Look for thicker arms, legs, torsos, the whole deal.

Don't tag [[toned]] characters as [[muscular]]. If the character has an athletic build that's not overly bulky, use [[toned]] instead.

Don't tag female characters intentionally drawn to look like men (e.g. [[Cho Marisa]] with a beard, a woman drawn to look like [[Kenshiro]], etc) as [[muscular female]]s.

h4. Examples

title: the_hillbilly_(dead_by_daylight)
body:
A character from [[dead_by_daylight|Dead by Daylight]].

The Hillbilly, also known as Max Thompson Jr., is a highly mobile Killer, able to run with tremendous speed while revving his [[chainsaw]].

He is usually depicted as a [[balding]], [[disfigured]] man, wearing [[jeans]], a [[dirty]] and [[torn_shirt|torn]] [[grey_shirt|grey]] [[sleeveless_shirt|sleeveless shirt]], wielding a chainsaw and a [[hammer]] as his weapons.

title: the_artist_(dead_by_daylight)
body:
The Artist, a character from [[dead_by_daylight|Dead by Daylight]], is usually depicted as a [[tall_female|tall woman]] with a [[long_neck|long neck]], [[long_hair|long]], [[black_hair|black hair]], wearing a [[red_dress]].
Both of her hands are [[double_amputee|amputated]] and replaced with ink, which she uses as her weapon.

title: the_trapper_(dead_by_daylight)
body:
A character featured in [[dead_by_daylight|Dead by Daylight]] and [[hooked_on_you|Hooked on You]].

The Trapper, also known as Evan Macmillan, is an area-control Killer, able to place deadly [[bear_trap|bear traps]] for Survivors to step into.

He is usually depicted as a [[bald]], [[mask|masked]], [[muscular_male|muscular male]] with [[scar|scars]] on his chest, [[hook|hooks]] and [[spikes]] protruding from his shoulder area, wearing [[overalls]] and wielding a [[cleaver]] as his main weapon.

title: the_wraith_(dead_by_daylight)
body:
A character featured in [[Dead by Daylight]] and [[Hooked on You]].

The Wraith, also known as Philip Ojomo, is a stealth Killer, able to become [[transparent]] and move with tremendous speed via the ringing of his weapon, the Wailing Bell, which is made out of his former bosses' [[skull]] and [[spine]]

He is usually depicted as a tall, [[grey_skin|grey skinned]] man with [[antlers|antler]] like growths coming out of his head, three stripes of grey [[facepaint]] on his face, wearing a dark [[cloak]], with [[bandages]] on his torso.

title: unused_character_(kill_me_baby)
body:
A nameless, [[prototype design|unused character]] from [[Kill Me Baby]].

She was originally planned to be a rival of [[Goshiki Agiri]], but ended up being unused in the manga due to her planned comic relief role already being taken up by [[Oribe Yasuna]]. Despite this, she became popular after the release of the artbook and would have sporadic cameo appearances in the anime adaptation. Because of this, she is generally considered "canon" by fans despite the lack of appearances.

She has [[red hair|red]] [[medium hair]] and [[green eyes]] with a long [[braid]]. In her brief appearance in the anime, she is voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]].

title: oni
body:
A creature from Japanese folklore. Usually translated as "demon" or "[[ogre]]".

Traditionally depicted with [[red skin|red]] or [[blue skin]], a [[tiger print]] [[loincloth]], and [[horns]]. Oni horns can be depicted in various ways, whether it be as long, smooth, [[skin-covered horns|skin-covered]] or otherwise the same color as the skin, located on the forehead; or [[cone horns|cone-shaped]] in any number of colors, whether it be white, grey, yellow, etc. atop their head. Their weapon of choice is the [[spiked club]], particularly the [[kanabou]]. They are violent and favor brawn over brains.

Save for the horns, modern depictions tend to mute these characteristics considerably or entirely, especially in female characters, only keeping their iconic dual horns intact.

Oni are commonly associated with [[Setsubun]], a holiday taking place on February 3rd, the last day of winter in the traditional Japanese calendar. On this day it is tradition to throw roasted soybeans in order to drive away oni; this practice is known as [[mamemaki]].

Typical examples of oni are [[Lum]], [[Gedomaru]], [[Ibuki Suika]] and [[Hoshiguma Yuugi]].

title: genshiken
body:
[i][b]GENSHIKEN[/b][/i] (げんしけん) is a manga created by [[Kio Shimoku]] about a university [[otaku]] club. It is a slice of life comedy series focusing on otaku life and its consequences.

The title is a shortening of the club's official name, [b]GEN[/b]dai [b]SHI[/b]kaku Bunka [b]KEN[/b]kyūkai (現代視覚文化研究会), which is translated as [i][b]The Society for the Study of Modern Visual Culture[/b][/i]. It is based on a club that existed at Kio's alma mater during his university days, but the Genshiken is located at [[Shiou University]], which is based on the Tama Campus of Chuo University (中央大学) in Hachiouji, Tokyo.

Serialized in Kodansha's [i]Afternoon[/i] from 2002-2006, the manga series continued for a second season as Genshiken II ([i]Genshiken Nidaime[/i] or [i]Genshiken Second Generation[/i]), which was released in December 2010 and ended in August 2016.

The original manga was also adapted into two separate TV anime series by Genco in 2004 and 2007, as well as a 3 episode OVA in 2006. Additionally, Kio Shimoku announced in the manga that a new TV anime adaptation of the [i]Second Generation[/i] manga was in the works with the title [i]Genshiken Nidaime[/i] (げんしけん 二代目 - [i]Genshiken Second Generation[/i]), later airing in Japan from July 6 to September 29, 2013.

A [i]Genshiken Second Season OAD[/i] or Original Animation DVD was bundled with the limited edition of the 15th volume of the Genshiken manga. It was released in Dec 20, 2013 with the title [i]Genshiken Nidaime No Roku DVD[/i] (げんしけん オリジナルアニメDVD). The story is set between the events of Genshiken 2 and the Genshiken Nidaime series so none of the new characters from Nidaime appear in this anime.

A spin-off, [[Kujibiki Unbalance]], was produced by Ajia-do Animation Works in 2006, along with a manga, illustrated by [[Koume Keito]].

[[Spotted Flower]], a manga periodically illustrated and produced by Kio outside of Afternoon since 2009, is loosely based on Genshiken.
